Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Alice in Wonderland
Reviews.Content: I agree, this is a very nice camera. It takes nice, high quality pictures and videos. It's easy to use, with a nice large screen, and plenty of memory. The face recognition feature is something I have never encountered before, and I really like it - it makes it really easy to find pictures.The only con to this camera is the use of AA batteries. It does go through them relatively quickly, so if you are going to be shooting all day, you really must carry a supply of them with you. It's a prejudice, but I do prefer rechargeable cameras.But, in spite of that, it's a really nice camera and I like it a lot!(Review of Kodak EasyShare C195 Digital Camera)

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195
Reviews.Author: jkb
Reviews.Content: So far, I am pleased with this digital camera.  Regular AA batteries don't last long, but went to AA Lithium batteries and no problems.  I like the 3" screen and picture taking is easy.  Pictures are clear and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Angie Martin "busy mom of 3"
Reviews.Content: This is such a great little camera. I had a Kodak C633 before that I loved but wanted to upgrade. This takes such sharp pictures and has even more features then my last one. It also has more zoom on it then my old one did and more mega pixels. Love the face finder and it seemed to take great pictures indoors. I also love the color of this camera it is a nice shade of purple. For the people who complain about the batteries going dead quickly the way to solve that is use rechargable batteries!! This is a great little investment, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Simple to Use, Hard to Love
Reviews.Author: Hal "Halbreck"
Reviews.Content: They sell this camera on it's ease of use, especially for sending pictures to social networks such as Facebook. And for cranking out little jpeg images to the web, it is just fine...however, it would be nice to have the option of taking higher quality photos, since they also advertise this camera as 14 megapixel. That's a joke, because while I'm sure the equipment is capable of shooting a very clear photo, it automatically compresses every image so that if you view it at actual size (or feel like making a large print) it's extremely fuzzy. This is probably in the interest of allowing you to cram more photos onto a card, but at least give us a choice to sacrifice some space for a crisper picture.That aside, it's also not great at regulating the blur that occurs from the slightest subject or hand movement. It's not the most expensive camera in the world, but you could go even cheaper for the quality Kodak is providing here. And if you want good quality photos, you might just have to spend a tad more money to get something decent.

Reviews.Title: Full of Features, But Fuzzy Photos
Reviews.Author: D. Phillips
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Kodak Z1275 for a couple of years and I loved it!  It was 14MP and full of features, most of which I eventually learned how to use.  I regularly had photos blown up to poster size or printed on pillow cases and blankets.  They were always crisp and clear when I used the automatic setting.  Unfortunately, Kodak does not make that camera any longer.  (My beloved camera fell off the back of a chair when taking photos two weekends ago so it is no longer working.)I looked for a Kodak camera with the same features.  What I found was the C195.  It is not exactly the same (e.g. 5x optical zoom vs. the Z1275 have 3X optical and another 5x digital), but most of the settings were exactly like the camera I loved.  It even uses 2 AA batteries and is the same size (pocket-worthy).  Despite noticing some dust under the display on the rear, I was thrilled with the first four test photos so I registered the camera the same day it arrived from Amazon.I did not really take "normal" photos until this past weekend.  I took 647 photos and videos while on a trip to Disney.  As my 4GB memory card filled up I decided to look for bad photos and delete them to make extra space.  That is when I noticed that some of the pictures looked blurry.  I wear glasses so I asked several other people for their opinions and they agreed.  I thought it might be related to the dust under 1/8 of the screen on the back, but when I downloaded the photos to my computer I found that every 4th, 5th, or 6th photo was horribly blurry.  That was very frustrating, but also very sad as many of those photos were once-in-a-lifetime shots (e.g. my wife making very close eye contact with one of the Boys II Men singers).  I am sending this camera back to Amazon tomorrow.  I am not going to buy another C-series camera from Kodak.  Those moments cannot be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: TXMommy
Reviews.Content: After buying a Nikon Cool Pics to replace my broken Kodak EasyShare, I was very disappointed. I could never get a clear picture from the Nikon. So, we checked out Amazon and found this great EasyShare! I really enjoy using this camera. The pictures are generally very crisp and the "smart capture" feature is very helpful.The only disappointment I have is that the batteries and the memory card are in the same compartment. So, every time I remove the memory card, the batteries become loose.However, this camera is very easy to use, and takes great photos and video.

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Dawn E. Dunivant
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a month.  It makes great pictures and videos but it does eat the batteries.  That is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Pics okay, camera seems cheap
Reviews.Author: Victoria A. Twarog
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, I bought a Kodak Easy Share, 7 megapixels, for $99.00.  I love the camera but decided to buy another Kodak only this time with 14 megapixels because everyone told me that with more megapixels, the photos would be even clearer.  Well, that was a waste of money for me.  For one thing, my old camera is sturdier and the features easier to access, the buttons are stronger and are easier to use --  even the telescopic/wide lens work better and are not clumsy, like on the the C195 model.  Sometimes, my camera will take the picture (by itself) while I'm focusing and other times, the "clicker" seems to stick.  In fairness, the photos turn out looking pretty good but not any better than on my older model and, in some cases, not as good.  I used this camera often so I could really test it out and be able to present a thoroughly researched review.In summary, I did not notice any real difference between the 7 megapixels camera versus the 14.  Both cameras take good pictures.  However, the quality of the C195 is definitely much cheaper and it frequently does "its own thing"I was going to use my old camera as a backup and use the new one as my primary camera.  However, I am now going to reverse that order and go back to my reliable, older Kodak.  It has never disappointed me and the photos are beautiful.I guess it's true what they say about change.  In many cases, change doesn't mean better especially if it doesn't produce positive results. Come to think of it, I guess that is true of anything in life. :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195
Reviews.Author: gopowershome
Reviews.Content: This little camera fits easily in a back pocket or purse, which is why I got it. It doesn't come with a manual but is pretty easy to figure out. Getting to know the adjustments, light for example, takes a little practice but the learning curve is pretty fast. A wonderful, compact camera that takes great pictures. The easy share feature is fantastic.  Just tag the photo and when uploading, the photos will automatically be sent to social media apps while also being uploaded to the computer photo program. This camera is perfect for young people just starting out with photography, as well as experienced photographers who like to have a camera with them but not schlep around the equipment. I have a Nikon D90 but do not take it with me everywhere I go. The C195 in my purse allows me to be able to take photos anywhere!  Love the color purple!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Jane Ellen Kerns "silkie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 20 year old daughter for Christmas. It was a much nicer camera then I expected. I have a 700.00 camera and the photo quality was just as good if not better than my own camera, mine is a few years older but for 79.00 it was an amazing very easy to use camera. She loves face book and this camera makes it easy to share pictures online. Small, it fits easily into her purse but has a nice large screen for viewing! Very user friendly! JUST POINT AND SHOOT! Highly recommend as an everyday take anywhere camera!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, great buy for average photo-taker
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a very good camera, my only issue was that (for me)the buttons are too small, not a big deal really but it would be nice to be able to press the navigation keys without using a finger nail. Other that that picture quality is good, shake suppression works fine (excellent pictures if on a tripod)has 3 color modes plus B&W; and sepia. low light photos are spot on. panorama mode works but could of been refine a bit more. video is very nice. takes two AA batteries instead of a rechargeable one, which i like because its cheaper to have extra batteries on hand when you need them. Comes with 5x optical zoom which is the most I've seen for a camera of this price, but no digital zoom as far as i can tell not that its worth missing. overall 4/5

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Shelton
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. I did some comparison and chose this camera because of the 14 mp, the 5X zoom and the great price.  The size is good and it's easy to use which is what I was looking for.  I did have to purchase an SD card separately which I feel Kodak should have included, but that wasn't a big expense.  I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality
Reviews.Author: A. Murray "shoppingpro"
Reviews.Content: The picture clairity is impressive and the zoom is powerful.  The battery life has been the same as other cameras I have owned.  The only mild comment I would make about the Ease of Use would be that the buttons are flush with the casing, so you have to use your fingertip firmly in the right spot to get the buttons to press.  Not a big deal, but a slight raising of them would make this a perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: Birthday gift to myself
Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: Well i have had a Kodak c310 since 2007 that i bought for $100 at my local Rite Aid. I just wanted a camera just to start my new hobby of photography. All of the pictures were OK but i knew i would out grow this camera. So  5 years i gave life to my C310 and it died on me. So i decide to find my new love......the Kodak c195. This camera zoom 5x, 14mp pixel is fantastic. Be still my heart the colors are so vibrant. The features are great too. I think that this will be helpful to  any amateur photography on there way to great masterpieces for their own collection. Plus easy upload and video with sound puts my old C310 to shame. I will tell all my friend and family about my new KodakC195.

Reviews.Title: No support !
Reviews.Author: cheryl bruns
Reviews.Content: Do not buy one of these cameras ! Kodak has discontinued this line and there is no online help or support. As most new items is does not come with a instruction booklet. You are refered to the Kodak web site. Once you find this item and click for on line instructions you get a notice that this item is no longer supported. I then tried to call the 800 number. The automated system tells you the same thing, however if you stay on line you can speak with a rep....but have your credit card ready cause its gonna cost you !! Really, I just bought a new camera and its out of production and the manufacturer wants to charge me to tell me how to work my NEW purchase ! I have to say way to screw people AMAZON for still selling this product and never mentioning its not supported !!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Tiaheal
Reviews.Content: It was bought as a gift for my step-daughter. My husband wanted to play with it before we sent it to her. Men lol. Takes really nice pictures and the blue is so pretty. We are going to get one for ourselves now. Nice pictures, clear, great price and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: purple passion
Reviews.Author: Amy Miller
Reviews.Content: I Love this camera.  I had a kodak easyshare c173 or something like that and have had it for 6 or more years.  I had no idea that there was a camera that took pics this good and this inexpensive.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT Buy
Reviews.Author: Hedda Abbott "LV Mom"
Reviews.Content: Manufacturer no longer supports this camera.  I purchased it but cannot upload my pictures from it.  A total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera.
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It is a perfect camera for travel for us.  The pictures are clear and amazing.  It is super easy to use.  The color ROCKS!  I have put this camera thru a beating, and it just keeps working.  It has been all over the world in my carry on bag.  It has been bumped, squished, dropped, wet, sandy, and left helplessly in the direct sunshine on a car dash...yet, it still keeps on working...perfectly.  Super cute, super affordable, great travel buddy, amazing photos!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Herrmann
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kodak Easyshare because I owned one before this & absolutely loved it! (The only reason I dont have the last one is because my ex got it in the divorce). It takes BEAUTIFUL, high quality pictures AND video! And so so so easy to use! I know my next camera will also be a Kodak Easyshare & I already recommend it to everyone! You cant beat the price for such an awesome camera!

Reviews.Title: Great, simple camera
Reviews.Author: Anniedoll
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 14 year old to take on a school sponsored trip.  It worked great!  Easy for her to use. Pictures came out beautifully.  I'll soon get another - this time for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price. Large LCD screen. Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: David N. Bergeron "Marine101"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my wife.  Easy to use. Large viewing LCD screen.  She's happy !

Reviews.Title: DIscontinued Item
Reviews.Author: Antonia M. Ramondini "Toni"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item because I needed a camera that would be easy to share photos via the web and e-mail.  When I received it and went to the Kodak website to download the software that allows you to share photos, I was surprised to find out that the item was discontinued and the software was no longer available.  In addition, support for the item was no longer available,  I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Out of date
Reviews.Author: EJaros
Reviews.Content: Seemed like a nice camera, but when I received it I found out that Kodak no longer support this model.  Returned the camera, fast credit from supplier.

Reviews.Title: Not EASY at all to share!
Reviews.Author: DaphneHunter "Daphne"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for a friend who has a really poor quality camera phone, but who likes to post pictures directly to Facebook.  I though, "This is the perfect small camera for her!  The "Share" button will simplify her life!"  No...First of all, do not make the foolish mistake I made.  I assumed you could "Share" anyplace there was wifi.  No.  You STILL have to connect the phone via USB, which in essence makes the "Share" button pointless...even it if DID work...Apparently, Windows upgraded their security and it blocks this from connecting as a camera automatically.  You will get an error message.  So, after trying a few different sites, a patch was finally downloaded that updated the software.  The camera, itself, didn't even COME with installation drivers...which is dumb on many levels.I can't even say this camera takes great pictures, because as of this rating I haven't seen any of them...still waiting for them to be posted.  Hopefully, at least the small size and good picture quality will convince my friend that her problems gettting the damn thing recognized wasn't all in vain.In essence, if you are looking for an easy, wifi capable, Facebook camera...this just isn't it.  I don't know what I should have gotten, but I'm very sad this gift turned out to be so much trouble!

Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: Tracey Thompson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son as a birthday present. It came ready to use with all the accessories  so there was nothing for him to go buy before he could use it.

Reviews.Title: Once a Kodak user, always a Kodak user
Reviews.Author: Magelu82
Reviews.Content: My freshman year of college, I received a 5.0 MP digital Kodak camera as a gift.  Six years later, the camera technology has BOOMED and improved from what I had.  After searching reviews for numerous "cheap" point and shoot cameras, I decided to go with the C195.  I had decided between a Nikon and a Kodak.  I LOVED my old Kodak, so I figured I'd try a newer model.  Some of the reviews said that this camera wasn't that good, but I've had it while traveling in Europe and out of the HUNDREDS of photos I've taken with it now, I have had only 3 "bad" pictures, and I'd attribute that to operator failure.  It's a cheap camera, and a GREAT camera for what you're paying for.  I love it and at this point, I am a dedicated Kodak user! You will not be sorry with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Hall "Gift Giver"
Reviews.Content: The camera was extremely easy to set up and use.  It takes great pictures, even my three year old grandson was able to take a picture of me and my granddaughter!  The only drawback is that the buttons are so small on the top of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Bergie63
Reviews.Content: I bought myself the Kodak C195 in Purple of course.  This camera is the best little camera to carry in my purse everyday so I am ready to catch shots of my dogs, grandchildren or beautiful Scenery.  This camera has 14 Megapixels, way better photo's than an expensive camera I had,  I would recommend this camera to anyone,  The only little fault I have with the camera is that the on/off button is kinda small, you have to turn it off and on with your fingernail, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas Gift.
Reviews.Author: Saint305XL
Reviews.Content: My mom bought me this camera for Christmas and I absolutely love it. I use it for small things, taking pictures to send back home and such, and it works perfectly. There isn't much I can say that is bad about this camera, and the bad things are pretty minuscule too. First, I am a big man and I have huge hands and fingers and the buttons are so tiny, well, not really, but they are not big enough for my hands. I can manage with that though, so no biggie. Another gripe I had was there wasn't a memory card included, but again, it wasn't important really, they aren't expensive. My biggest complaint, and the only one that was important to me was the microphone built in the camera. It is very difficult to hear unless you talk quite loudly. But, it is something I can deal with because I don't take that many videos, I just wish it was louder. Some will complain about the battery, but my battery lasts for three days, even if I use it for 6 hours a day, I don't know why anyone is really complaining, just buy rechargeable batteries and your problem is solved. Oh, and the software you download is a big problem for me. It is slow and it takes a very long time to upload the photos, I have a fast computer, I can download 100 songs in seconds, but this software just takes about an hour to upload 20 pictures. That is my biggest complaint. I have sidestepped that though, now I just take my memory card and put it in my laptop SD slot and shazaam! Finished.Pros:Style and Design, Mega Pixels, Easy Share Button, Screen Size, Zoom, ISO, Features, Built In Memory (Not much, but useful).Cons:Software, Buttons Size, Built In Microphone, and No SD/HC Card.I hope this a little helpful. It is a great buy for the price and it will last. It has been 5 months since I have had the item and it is still in great condition. I hope you enjoy your purchase as much as I am enjoying mine.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Lydia Grace
Reviews.Content: Kodak is out of business, their support website is defunct.  Windows 7 does not recognize this correctly and will not import pictures from it.  It recognizes as a dvd drive.  There is no way to get the correct driver for this.  Got EasyShare from cnet but it would not install.  Nonspecfic failure.  Burns through batteries like crazy too.  Took one pic, and just trying to get the driver to load burned through the set of batteries that comes with it.  This is some kind of surplus item that is not supported any longer and is only worth 2 cents on the dollar.  Doubt if I can get my money back but will try.

Reviews.Title: Worst piece of consumer electronics I have purchased
Reviews.Author: Kennen Haas "Kennen"
Reviews.Content: The camera had terrible latency issues.I would throw it in the garbage if I was unable to return it.I turn it on. The screen comes on. I set the date and time.I try to activate the zoom. I seems not to work, about 3-4 seconds later the zooming occurs.I press the button to take a picture... nothing. I press again and, click, picture taken. I try to uses the thumb pad to delete the picture, no response. The screen goes black. At this point the camera is totally non-responsive.I press the power button to turn it off, but the lens stays open for about 10 seconds before it goes off.This is the second Kodak camera I have purchased that has been dysfunctional to the point of being useless.Fool me once... you know the rest.

Reviews.Title: Stopped Working Twice
Reviews.Author: Mama of Two
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, easy to use camera for our eight year old that only upset her every time it crapped out with a message reading, "LENS OBSTRUCTED." Upon going through Kodak for warranty coverage, I have to send it to Illinois from CA and they will decide if it should be covered under warranty (even though it is less than six months we have had it) in which case if it is not, I need to pay the cost to have it returned and the inspection fee or the cost to have it repaired being that they may or may not send a new one vs a refurbished one that more than likely crapped out for the very same reason. Thus, would not recommend this purchase. Read reviews, shop around, and choose something else.

Reviews.Title: I can't upload my pics.
Reviews.Author: Susan M Posluszny
Reviews.Content: I tried to download the software but it doesn't exist anymore.  I tried to upload the pics without the software and the windows that are supposed to pop up so I can import them do not pop up.  I am going to call Kodak.  If they can't help I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lesa Bryant
Reviews.Content: I was worried that it would be cheaply made...I was so pleasantly surprised! Very small and portable too...slips easily into a purse.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: christine olbrias
Reviews.Content: I love it. Just as it was described. No problems and no need to contact customer service. Better quality than i expected for the price. I would recomend anyone to buy.

Reviews.Title: 1 star
Reviews.Author: Henderson
Reviews.Content: This camera was a dissapintment . To sum it up it , it was good money spent on a bad product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MiltRand7 "Milton"
Reviews.Content: Excellent  camera and I wouild recommend it to my friends.  It shoots clear pictures, easy to operate and understand.  Lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Easy share camera.
Reviews.Author: Carmen A. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Great buy. Price was excellent and the camera takes beautiful pictures. Good replacement for a lower megapixels one. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: RETURNED
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: I could not get the photos to download. The company no longer has on line or phone tech support available. The website indicates their is tech support, but that is not true.

Reviews.Title: Bought for myself
Reviews.Author: C. Drake "Java Jane of the Jungle"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It's easy to use.  Takes great pictures and uploading photos to my computer is really easy.

Reviews.Title: no manufacturer support
Reviews.Author: Berthile Tabor
Reviews.Content: Had difficultity downloading photos.  When we contacted the manufacturer they said they no longer supported the product and their was no website either.  After much persistence and trial and error, we were finally able to use the camera.  I can't tell you how many times we came close to throwing it out the window.

Reviews.Title: terrible kodak product
Reviews.Author: daria leibach
Reviews.Content: This camera worked twice. Will not open or close all the way.  Person I gave it to was afraid to tell me it wasn't working so we have missed our return opportunity.  I have an older kodak easy share camera that takes beautiful pictures but the knobs won't turn anymore. I am one buyingkodak cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good little point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: RedstoneManor
Reviews.Content: I owned one in purple that I used every day, and I LOVED that camera...loved it to death. So I had to get another one! For the price, I think it's a really good camera. I've gotten some beautiful shots with it. The particular camera that I just bought has some quirks that makes me miss my purple one, but it's still okay. Durable, too, and small enough to fit in a pocket while still having enough substance to it that I can steady it for clear shots. I also like the HD filming option, that has been awesome!

Reviews.Title: Used a handful of times; battery power gone
Reviews.Author: M. A. Elmes
Reviews.Content: I had a C195 for years and loved it, so when I accidentally dropped it and broke the lens I immediately replaced it with a new C195. After only a week's use, the new camera started alerting me that battery power was low and shutting off automatically every time I went to take a picture. I tried new batteries, but they didn't make a difference, so I returned it, thinking it must be defective; but the replacement (another C195) is doing the same thing. It seems to be an issue either with the door to the battery area not closing properly, or the battery power just not getting through to the system -- but I am highly dissatisfied. I can't even get one picture off before the camera shuts back off again. It should be noted that it worked fine for the first few weeks, and then this issue came about. I did not drop this camera and was extremely careful with it, since I had dropped and broken the first one, so I can only imagine this is a manufacturing defect. Since it's been present in the past two cameras I have bought, I'm done with these.

Reviews.Title: Love camera, not liking sender so much.
Reviews.Author: Mary A. Cavender
Reviews.Content: I Iove this little camera. My only problem is I ordered a "NEW" camera. It came in an unsealed original box with the computer cable, 2 dead batteries, and some kids pictures on the camera.  The wrist strap is missing. I paid for a NEW camera and received a USED one. Not happy about that.

Reviews.Title: C195
Reviews.Author: Ronnie Mac "javascript"
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome .. it takes beautiful pictures and is easy to use .  The only thing I can think of - in a negative respect - is it doesn't take pics of moving objects very well , but I guess it would if they were taken as a video , which I have yet to try .  For the money , you can't go wrong with this camera. I'd highly recommend it to anyone !!!

Reviews.Title: I love my first digital camera!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: j-me
Reviews.Content: I purchased the this camera and really love it! I am especially happy with the length of time the batteries have lasted.It is easy to use and the pictures are excellant. The only change I would make would be the way you turn it on;the button is extremely tiny and almost flush with the camera body ; I do have a differcult time pressing it

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Snowbird
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my sons older EasyShare C653 that has literally gone through more then its share of abuse. We are very happy with that facts that this camera is similar in function making him feel at ease with the camera from the minute he first opened the box. The use of AA batteries is a big plus as is the use of SDHC media so all the old cards can be used with the new camera.I would rate the quality of the photos as quite good and ease of use as excellent. I hope it's as durable as the old camera it's replacing, that thing was a rock. It still works but the dog had a field day with it and the battery door is now... well... unusable. But it took a playful German Shepard Puppy looking for a chew toy to render the old Kodiak in need of repair.

Reviews.Title: Name says it all.
Reviews.Author: Howard Jones "patriot54"
Reviews.Content: Great camera model. I bought 4 EasyShare cameras, 3-C183's & 1 C-195. All work the same way. Easy to get Great Pics with little or no setup. Another key feature: Easy as pie to share not only pics, but video too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Dick Caro
Reviews.Content: This little camera offers features of cameras twice the price. I like the 5x optical zoom. At 14 megapixels even digital zoom or cropping the photo to get a close-up works well. This is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony B. Scroggins
Reviews.Content: A complete camera with outstanding features.  I have used the camera a least five times since the purchase and every picture has been excellent.  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a capable camera at a reasonable cost.  A+++++++++

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: marimarez
Reviews.Content: Second Kodak Easy Share purchased for gift. Son was thrilled with it, likes the large display and the ease of use. Wonderful camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Deb "zooville4"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer at all so I need something easy to use and this is it.  This camera takes really nice pictures, I have an older Kodak camera and also another brand.  I'll always come back to Kodak. The extra features makes it easy to take a good picture whatever the skill level.Love the color too!

Reviews.Title: EATS BATTERIES
Reviews.Author: DustinBullfight
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Camera because it was Purple and I had been using an older Kodak EasyShare for several years that I had never had an issue with.  This Camera will not work more than a few mins and you have to replace the batteries.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera but wish it came with rechargeable batteries
Reviews.Author: mjmh
Reviews.Content: It takes wonderful pictures and is easy to use.  The size is great to fit into purse or bag.  The only two downsides I can see is the down loading software which does not work with my operating system (Linex) which is interesting because my son's later model easy share (different model) camera down loading device does work with my operating system.  The computer sees the camera as just another drive which is the best way to give a universal down load feature.  This camera is not seen that way and I am not sure why.The other point is rechargeable batteries would have been nice to add since it makes the camera more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good, Economical Camera
Reviews.Author: Mother of 9
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use for my small business.  I needed something with a good picture quality which was small and easy to use.  This camera fulfilled all 3 requirements.  It doesn't have a superb zoom, but with its large file size, if you needed to crop a small area out of a larger picture, it would work fine.  It is a standard point-and-shoot camera, starts up fast and takes pictures quickly.  It also fits in a pocket so it can be carried around to take pictures in different locations.  Uses a standard SD card, which can be inserted into a card reader.  Also has some internal memory.  Pictures can also be transferred to the computer with the cord which Kodak supplies.  This was a very satisfactory purchase at a fine price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Dream41495 "***JEANIE***"
Reviews.Content: I would really like to give it a 4-1/2 star rating on this, but couldn't get the half star to stay. Here's my explanation why:Pros:Beautiful camera, wonderful large screen, easy to operate, uses 2 AA batteries, no special batteries needed, nice adjustable setting on the picture size format from 1mp 4:3, 2mp 16:9, 3mp 4:3, 6mp 4:3, 10mp 16:9, 12mp 3:2, 14mp 4:3 video out options NTSC/PAL, upgradable memory to 32mp. Has automatic focus, I found it quite easy to setup and program the camera. I do have to admit it does take some really good pictures though!! I'm overall quite pleased with the camera, even with it's little cons to it, mainly because of the quality of pictures it takes and ease of setting up the program on the camera itself.  Yes, I would certainly recommend this camera.Cons:Looking at the back of the camera in the sun/daylight is sometimes very hard to see, way too bright no matter how far down you take the light setting on the camera. The download link from Kodak is not supported anymore, you have to hunt down the link yourself, after installing the drive and program on the camera, then I found out that it does not support sending to email, FaceBook or social media.  On the 14mp that comes with the camera, you can only take an 8 second video and the sound is very hard to hear on there. The buttons on the top and back of the camera are a little hard to get to, luckily I have finger nails and use the tip of them to turn the camera on or the button selections on the back right of the view finder. Also the highest memory card you can go is a 32mp. (that fits in the same compartment the batteries go into).

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sidney McField
Reviews.Content: on timeas expectedproperly packagedno complaintssatisfieda positive overall experience everything worked out just great. Thank You

Reviews.Title: Best camera i have ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: d ray
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome, it takes pictures that look like pro photography and you can set the red-eye preflash.I like the settings because they are easy to set and you get info of what mode you are on.A kid can easily use this camera.If you are taking pictures outside on a sunny day there is no glare in the picture.Not to mention the share button its cool.I would highly recommend this camera to a friend.Trust me you will love it.I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: granchildren

Reviews.Content: simple and easy to use.  nothing fancy.  just what I wanted in an extra camera to take random photos.  love the fact that the pics transfer easy to social media sites.  glad I purchased it

Reviews.Title: One of the cheapest cameras around. Good lens bad sensor
Reviews.Author: Pikkidok
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was cheap,  it is a Kodak and simply for the fun of having an inexpensive AA powered camera.It cost me less than USD50 as I believe retailers of clearing stocks and quite possibly there will not be manufacturer warranty anymore.I will not review the video or movie aspect as I have not used it for recording any video.The camera is well built although it is plasticky.It is well designed and comfortable to hold.It looks really nice and no one will believe it cost less than USD50.The plastic however is an oil magnet and it can get dirty easily but you can wipe the dirt off just as easily.The screen is large and bright. One of its strongest points.On top of the camera are 3 tiny buttons. On/Off switch, Mode button and the Flash button.Not suitable if you have very fat fingers. You need to use your nails to push them.If you are used to most mainstream Japanese brand cameras, the user interface is a bit different but you will get used to it.I must say users of these camera is either a novice or someone who are not much into photography.It can function without much adjustment. Switch on and shoot away.It obviously lacks input into some settings unlike other more expensive cameras. I guess most users will not be bothered with these.Default mode is the Smart capture mode where the camera does everything for you. You only decide whether you want flash auto, on or off. Everything else is done for you. You can decide how many mega pixels you want your pictures to be captured.You have the P mode or program mode where you can input ISO settings, focusing and metering options.Then you have the scene mode where you can select from a few scenes to optimize the settings for your picture.The lens is actually quite good. Sharp. Minimal distortion and few flares.However I think the CCD sensor is not on par with the lens.The CCD sensor is very likely old tech and is not very sensitive and the processors is probably not top notch.Canon and Nikon have very good sensors which are more sensitive despite the same size as this.The photos show color smearing  and noise even at low ISO of 200.The colors are dull except when shot at the lowest ISO. Pictures are sharp though.Essentially a set of good lens in front of a bad sensor.The camera compensates for its weak sensor by automatically setting a low ISO for most non-flash shotsWith low ISO, the shutter speed will be slow. This will cause blurry shots unless you have rock steady hands.In summary,There is a good reason to buy this camera. It is cheap and it uses AA batteries.But remember to use flash indoors even if you think it is relatively bright. The camera sensor cannot handle poor light condition too well. Much worse compared to other compacts but then, other compacts are more expensive and may have a more advanced CMOS sensor.Remember to use a tripod if you do not want to use the flash.Outdoors, if bright, keep a steady hand and you will be rewarded with sharp photographs.Despite this camera's critical weaknesses.I still like it. I like cheap AA powered compacts and it is a soon to be rare Kodak camera

And they said that Kodak no longer supports the Easyshare software problems.  I am able to use the memory card to download pictures but since I cannot download the "set up" by the directions given with the camera I cannot use the "SHARE" button to automatically link the pictures to facebook.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: moosie2797
Reviews.Content: This is a Nice little camera, it is very easy to use settings are not complicated I have had 2 of them.  My pictures were not coming out very well, it was difficult to get the camera to focus to anything up close.  It takes very good pics if your subject is several feet away but trying to get a close up picture is hard.  My kids hated this camera because I would go to take a picture and trying to get a nice focused one and it would take so many try's my kids were bored and wanted to leave so the pictures I had in the and no one was smiling anymore.  I thought it was my camera o I purchased another one but realized right away both cameras worked the same way. And I never could get the share button to work in either camera either.  I went with this camera mostly because it was Kodak like my hubby has it for fords. So I was very disappointed with this camera  and for the same price as this one I got a totally different brand camera that is amazing and oes so much more than this one.  I gave my older Kodak to my daughter and resold the other.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShared C195 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Thank you soo much i love this product and everything was in one piece new and works great. i been using it and I'm so happy with it. :))

Reviews.Title: easy & inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: It took a while to get the camera but it was in perfect condition.  I like the color, easy instructions that were correct.  Would have been nice to also have more in depth instructions, though it IS just what I wanted.  I had feared it would be hard to hold because it is so narrow, this is true, keep putting my fingers on screen.  I hadn't relized there wasn't a viewfinder, in the sun it is difficult to only have the LED screen.  For the $ and ease it is worth it all in all.

Reviews.Title: refurbished cameras are good value
Reviews.Author: smedley
Reviews.Content: We use simple cameras like this in one of our businesses, and I've found buying refurbished to be a great way to save some front side moola. We used this one to replace a similar (but earlier) Kodak Easyshare C-something, and don't like it as well as the earlier one. The camera's fine, but the features aren't same we were used to. As far as inexpensive cameras go, we'll never buy new again. The refurbished ones are about half the price, and with Amazon's warranty, how can you go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: muffingod26
Reviews.Content: I got it for Christmas one year. It works good. Not the best quality. Good for general pictures and videos. Not good for TV Screen or for stuff like fireworks. Overall I think its an "OK" camera

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift
Reviews.Author: A. Cusick
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera for my granddaughter who was turning13, and decided on the Kodak Easy Share. She absolutely loved the camera, especially the color (purple), and started taking pictures immediately.  It was very easy for her to use and a perfect starter camera.

Reviews.Title: BLURRY BLURRY BLURRY
Reviews.Author: Photo Dog
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my older C series Kodak Easy Share to this model. Loved the purple color, large screen, and price. Played with it around the house for a few days, and it seemed to be good. So we decided to take it with us to the Animal & Magic Kingdom that weekend. Took LOTS of photos with it and when viewing them on the screen the looked good.My one mission was to get a great picture of a Giraffe. So when we did the safari ride my camera was ready to go, we get to the giraffe area and they were in reaching distance of us. Go to take a photo and...Batteries died. Even though a moment prior the battery life showed half life. Mind you the camera was less than a week old with brand new batteries. So we missed the opportunities with the Giraffe's. As for the rest of the safari we used our cell phones.I had read other reviews on this product saying it took blurry photos, and the battery life was bad. I associated it to the user rather than the camera (could not have been more wrong). Anyways we purchased new batteries, again and continued using it for the duration of our vacation. Once we got home and went to show our family the photos on the computer, that's when we realized over 70% of them were blurry!!! We even had it set on either the sports mode or blur reduction mode the entire time! Our cell phones took better photos as far as clarity. Very dissapointed with this camera. I believe the older model works better, and the battery life lasted 5x longer with the older series. DONT BUY THIS CAMERA, if your wanting to use it for family trips or once in a lifetime moments. I'm sending it back tomorrow for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: caroline "Caroline"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera after having trouble with my $400 camera. I kept accidentally changing a setting and had terrible pictures over and over (with the old camera). I LOVE THIS KODAK. it is easy to use.. And Simple menus!!

Reviews.Title: more than I bargained for....
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: I ordered this easy share camera because I dropped my old one.  I didn't realize I was getting an upgrade for less money.  I was unsure how to set it up without a CD so i called the kodak and was pleasantly surprised to get a real person who talked me thru the process.  Not a small feat for an old fart like me.  I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: MommaMia
Reviews.Content: I shopped quite awhile for an easy to use, reliable, non-expensive and durable camera and found the Kodak EasyShare to be just what the Dr. ordered.  It takes great shots and I'm glad that I took time to order this item.  It suits me perfectly and I would recommend this item to anyone in the market.  2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Brandy Emberton
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kodak camera in the last 10 years or so.  They're always easy to use and take great point and shoot pictures!  This model is no exception!  It is light weight, the color of the actual camera is great, the quality of the pictures are superb, and the price was perfect!  This camera is exactly what I was looking for!

Reviews.Title: totally refreshing
Reviews.Author: Amy Auerbach
Reviews.Content: Got this one as a gift and was quite surprised with its functionality.  Went from a 6.1mp to 14mp totally awesome. I'm totally liking the "share" button.  On the downside a lot of users say not good on regular batteries. They suggest lithium. Will consider trying lithum instead. Overall, great gift for the little photographer in me. Compared to the old camera I had before much better digital quality.

Reviews.Title: Very, Very NICE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Timewarpone
Reviews.Content: Takes very clear pics and video. Has a very large viewing screen. Very intuitive menu. Very easy to use and set up. We knew ahead of time that it takes AA batteries so we bought some Sanyo Eneloop AA Rechargeable. Problem solved!!!Highly Recommended!!!!! The color is awesome too!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Tara K. Perryman
Reviews.Content: Takes very good pictures. Easy to use. Did not come with a manual on how to utilize the different features, but with a little common sense you can figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera, including the price
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Ramirez Franco
Reviews.Content: This is a good Camera. Good resolution.Just a little bit slow to save the pictures, but good quality.Good Price.

Reviews.Title: love my new camera!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: j-me
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I've purchased although I have used others and I am very pleased with it.I am esp. impressed at how long the batteries have lasted;I still have the original ones in it!!This seems to be the main problem I hear about digital cameras... The 3' screen makes a big difference compared to ones I've used and the pictures are really clear.The only problem I have is when I try to focus a picture it seems like it zooms in or out too quickly but it's not anything that would make me not choose this same camera again! I'd recommend it to anyone!!!!!!! I'd also like to comment on Amazon.com. This is my first purchase;I am extremely satisfied with their help.

Reviews.Title: Utterly useless; why does Amazon sell these without a warning?
Reviews.Author: Sarang Gopalakrishnan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap camera and ordered this, assuming that any item in stock, four-star-rated, and without obvious warning signs would be a _functional camera._ Instead, I got this piece of vintage junk, which isn't recognized by either of my computers (mac and windows 8 resp.), and which was apparently discontinued _years ago_ by Kodak and has not been supported for years. I went back to the reviews and found that all the favorable ones were from ~2010. I have no idea why Kodak turned off PC/Mac support but what I am really irritated by is the lack of warning signs on the Amazon page for this camera. The market for cheap cameras largely consists of people who (like me) DO NOT CARE about cameras, and assume that the top search results on Amazon are (regardless of quality) THINGS THAT WORK, rather than the dumber kind of collectors' items. Apparently not.

Reviews.Title: kodak C195
Reviews.Author: Batman "Batman"
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera, with big resolution (14+ Mpixels) and a 3" display.  Use Lithium AA's or rechargeables - regular alkalines don't last very long.  Also, you will need a SDHC (sp?) memory chip to store more than a few photos.  The best deal on memory chips is probably off eBay, mailed from China, if you're not in a rush - else CompUsa had the best "walk-in local retail" price.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Kelly Ruppert
Reviews.Content: I needed a digital camera for work but use it for personal photos also; having gone through a more expensive Cannon camera I chose this Kodak for the price and described simpliciity of use. While the Kodak suggests that it is simple to use I (1)find it difficult to get the flash option I want - in some instances I have to reset it manually - loosing the shot I wanted/needed, (2) feel it changes scene settings by itself - I can't imagine I'm doing it because the button to change the scenes is also difficult to navigate, and (3) find that when photograping animals or people, pictures are blurry if they move just a slight bit. I guess you get what you pay for and if you only need to take very simple pictures in well lite rooms you'll be fine. Personally, next time I will return to the Cannon camera for better control and options even if it means spending more money.

Reviews.Title: Older is better, returned mine within 3 days
Reviews.Author: Freda
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 12/17/10 and thought I was getting a great deal at $80.  Wanted to replace my 5 yr old Kodak Easyshare that didn't have an LCD display and was 4MP.  This camera at 14MP takes the same quality pictures, no difference.  Another issue is that the batteries were dead in 2 days, sent by Kodak with the camera, with very little use, less than 20 photos taken.  My older Kodak could use the same batteries for 3 wks!  Also, the controls are difficult to navigate without using a fingernail and low light situations take poor photos, there's some type of delay for the flash and then you loose your shot.  Another issue is that it states takes SDHC cards but these cards have to be formatted, unlike regular SD cards and if you take the SDHC card out you have to go to the trouble of reformatting again.  SDHC card was not recognized when I tried to upload photos, whereas any SD card that I used in the camera was no problem uploading.  Also, didn't like the fact that there's no viewfinder for outside photos, in addition to LCD screen and you have to date stamp each photo that you take instead of just setting the date once and the date appearing on all photos you take unless you remove that option.  Took the camera back to the store and will use my old camera for awhile longer.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Pam Daniels
Reviews.Content: MY CAMERA NEVER CAME WITH THE CARD NECESSARY TO STORE AND EXPORT TO THE COMPUTER.  AND IT REPORTS THAT AFTER ONLY 4 PHOTOS,  "THE INTERNAL MEMORY IS FULL:" - AND YOU CAN'T DELETE UNLESS YOU DOWNLOAD THE SOFTWARE TO YOUR COMPUTER.  PROBLEM: THIS CAMERA IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH WINDOWS 7 OR 10.Totally sucks!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: CJ "CJ"
Reviews.Content: Just sending this back.  It doesn't come with any instructions and cannot figure out how to get it to work with my computer.  It gives an "instruction" to download software but doesn't tell you where or how to do so.  I'll now look for a different digital camera.  If anyone has any suggestions, please comment back to me.

Reviews.Title: GO WITH KODAK!
Reviews.Author: Emma Woodhouse "Austen Fan"
Reviews.Content: Probably obsolete now, but it shouldn't be!!  I take a lot of photos, I do weddings, I make cards with local scenes, and I always have my trusty Kodak Easyshare with me.  IT's easy to use, I love the EasyShare editing program, and I plan to get another EasyShare when this one wears out.

Reviews.Title: slow but decent
Reviews.Author: Anna Urban Gellman
Reviews.Content: Pro: Inexpensive, decent pix, takes AA batteries.Con: Takes forever to take two shots back to back...by time camera is ready to take next picture 5 seconds passed (i kid you not!!!!)

Reviews.Title: As Advertised NEW & looked Great!
Reviews.Author: Darlene Harrison
Reviews.Content: Have been looking for this Easyshare version locally @ stores for so long by Kodak! Happened to see it on Amazon & by the reviews, the shipper had excellent reviews! I did receive it prior to the deadline, shipped & bubbled correctly, NEW with all instructions & batteries & so far, so good!Could not get any better than this! Had a previous encounter with another seller & it was NOT good, but THIS one delivered as advertised!Great job Amazon! We will continue to do business with you in the future!

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I allways buy kodak products . And strongly recommend it anyone that want to get there money worth from a camera

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Brandy Haggard
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to work, which is great. It takes great pictures. It was also priced great when you don't want to pay a fortune for a camera. I would recommend this camera to anyone, that wants a great camera. My dad and sister wants one after they saw mine at a family cookout. I was glad to tell them all about it. Loving it!

Reviews.Title: Hannah's dream
Reviews.Author: Linda Hansen
Reviews.Content: Perfect! Bought for 11 year old grand daughter birthday. She was thrilled especially as it was red. She opened the box at restaurant and had it all figured out in 10 min. Lots of happy snaps followed. Not much photo storage room on camera so changed resolution to much smaller number. Also need to put in memory card for future. Fun, easy, and portable!

Reviews.Title: Software Availability
Reviews.Author: Fred Am Krampe
Reviews.Content: The camera did not come with the EasyShare software.  And unlike most digital cameras I cannot see it as a "external hard drive".  It shows up as a CDROM but with no picture files.  When I go online to download/install the easyshare software, Kodak tells me they no longer support or allow download for the software.They do have a smaller app, which is still available which I was able to get working.  Very disappointing.  Also, many of the "Share" services listed on the box are no longer supported.The image quality itself is good and the camera is responsive but the image transfer capabilities prevent me from recommending this camera.

Reviews.Title: kodak digital camera!!- Superb
Reviews.Author: Mich Wise
Reviews.Content: It's obviously isn't a professional amazing camera, but for the price it's very superb. I looked at several different cameras and decided I liked this one. It's a nice camera, easy to use. Great value

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Melissa Hall
Reviews.Content: Easy to get started and to operate.  I use rechargeable batteries which saves the environment and money.  I highly recommend this especially for the novice like myself.

Reviews.Title: Design flaw - not worth the risk
Reviews.Author: a theological strummer
Reviews.Content: After one day's use the batteries ran out while the lens was open - this caused an "obstructed lens" error. Nothing would shift this error or retract the lens.Returned for full refund

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera (Red)
Reviews.Author: J Tauriello
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare Cameras take very nice, clear pictures. I went to a few stores looking to buy one and could not find them anywhere. So glad I found one!

Reviews.Title: Design flaw - not worth the risk
Reviews.Author: a theological strummer
Reviews.Content: After one day's use the batteries ran out while the lens was open - this caused an "obstructed lens" error. Nothing would shift this error or retract the lens.Returned for full refund

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera (Red)
Reviews.Author: J Tauriello
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare Cameras take very nice, clear pictures. I went to a few stores looking to buy one and could not find them anywhere. So glad I found one!

Reviews.Title: it was for gifting
Reviews.Author: Alex Mohandas
Reviews.Content: I gifted it.. seems good.took a few pics. quality was nice. will share more feedback once i get feedback from the person who got it

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use - Great Results!
Reviews.Author: Lolene Blake
Reviews.Content: This lovely little camera works so well while traveling.  It's easy to pack, to carry, to use, and best of all, to get good photo results.  I chose this one because I had a similar one until it was misplaced while visiting Washington, DC. last year.  I used this camera last week while traveling in Italy and got fantastic photos in Rome, Venice, Florence, at Lake Garda, and in Tuscany.  What could be better than having photos of such great memories!

Reviews.Title: Everyone likes this camera too much!
Reviews.Author: Harleyschoolboy
Reviews.Content: I bought an Kodak Easyshare camera to replace the Sony SLR that I had for years (back then 3 MPs was a big number) when it got stolen. Did fine with it and almost had all the features figured out when IT was stolen. I picked up a replacement at a Pawn Shop and found out that Kodak no longer supports it. If you cannot find the disk you got with it, too bad. You can no longer download driver from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Senior Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip, and my old camera just died.  This camera was a perfect substitute.  The size is just right, not too small for older fingers, and not too big to carry around.  And you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: My 5 year old has yet to destroy it
Reviews.Author: F. Artknocker
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our 5 year old so she can have a camera of her own.  I looked at a few of the cameras designed for kids but for the same price or in some cases a little less I could get a camera with better resolution and features.  I was worried about this camera not being durable enough but so far so good.  It takes good pictures, is easy to use and she seems to be enjoying it.  Time will tell but so far she has dropped it a few times with no ill-effect.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: B.J.B.H.
Reviews.Content: I like my camera, Would have appreciated it if the lettering on the instructions were large enough for a senior citizen to see. This is important to you mature customers

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: SteelerNation
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures for the most part.The only cons are that the view screen is really hard to see in bright light.  Also, occasionally takes a blurry photo.  I wouldn't consider this a problem with the camera's photo taking, all cameras occasionally give a blurry photo due to insufficient lighting or unsteady hand, just that you can't tell it's blurry from the view screen, only later when you download.However, these minor issues are easily overlooked by me given the price, so overall, I'm satifsfied.  It works perfect for my intended use, which is a small camera for trips to the outdoors, that is cheap enough I won't be out major bucks if I leave it on my tailgate again and drive off like I did with my previous camera.

Reviews.Title: I cannot download software to my new c195 camera and Kodak doesn't support it anymore!
Reviews.Author: Wendy Dougherty "Gene Dougherty"
Reviews.Content: I would not have purchased this camera if I had known that Kodak no longer support the software.Spent the last two days trying to load the software on to my computer. I even tried to use older softwarefrom my Kodak c875 camera but that doesn't work either. I am frustrated and think about sending the camera back to the seller.I am disappointed.Gene Dougherty

Reviews.Title: Unsupported product
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey G. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Kodak has been out of business since 2012 -INCLUDING software support for their "Easyshare" app, which enables you to transfer pictures from the camera to your computer. Prior to that, the Easyshare C-195 was probably a really good camera. But now - unless you're a computer software genius- it's just a paperweight. NO ONE should be selling Kodak inventory!

Reviews.Title: A Battery Monster!
Reviews.Author: Pamela Sanders
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my son, per his words:  like most cameras, it takes pretty good pictures but has no charger & eats batteries! This camera goes through batteries, so unless you don't mind buying batteries alot, I would not recommend this product!  PJS

Reviews.Title: easy
Reviews.Author: Mark Baker
Reviews.Content: can be easy, read up on options, esp. to remember all if you dont use alot of them. I like good enough.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASYSHARE C195
Reviews.Author: DR. S. H. SHAWVER III
Reviews.Content: The C195 replaced M1033 KODAK EASY SHARE CAMERA (black). Previous model failed after taking a beating shooting pictures of engineering and construction projects, and buildiing systems throughout the country. Hated to lose the simplicity and versatility so the C195 replaced it. It was a step down. However the reliability is there and the quality is good for enlargement and sending via Internet to colleagues, clients, and for family as well. Strongly recommend if you want a simple, easy to use camera seperate from your phone. It takes the rough daily treatment often subjected to.The replacement of the previous expensive battery system with a less expensive two AA batteries helped reduced per unit use cost. Good pricing--iinexpensive.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mehak Zubia
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the easiest camera I have ever owned. It is durable, easy to focus and has all the options I need to make great family photos!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: I am a Realtor and take "tons" of photos.  This is my 2nd Kodak Easyshare Digital Camera.  Can't be without it.  Easy to use, easy to download.  Only downside, they made me pay $5.00 more to get one in red.  Without a doubt, a lot of camera for the small price.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: Works great for what I need a camera for.  I take a lot of photos if my grandchildren and they take pictures of everything

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie S Boyd
Reviews.Content: Only took about 6 pictures and got message memory full, battery already running out, had issues downloading to computer. Need a camera ASAP so will keep it for my trip to see Grandkids. I called Kodak after having issues downloading, Kodak does not give downloading help any more for this product. I have since decided to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from older Kodak
Reviews.Author: Cliff T. Johnson, PE, CSE
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat it for the price and ease of setting it up, I like the buttons for quick ON-Off, flash and modes. The menu is easy to use. The 16 MP size would allow you to make giant pictures, but is much to large for web stuff and needs to be adjusted, however, it has choices all the way from 1, 3, 6, 10, 12 up to 14 MP to fit everyone's needs. You don't have to manually adjust the focus, just point at what you are planning to capture and it will automatically adjust to close up to infinite ( give it a couple of seconds). Unfortunately, I run Microsoft Windows XP64 pro and Kodak did not provide software drivers, but I would rather use other photo editing applications. The only feature the old camera had over the C 195 is easy use of the SD card, The card was in a separate compartment from the batteries, the C 195 has the card and batteries in the same one, the good news is that DATE/TIME is not reset when you insert/remove the SD card. Thumbs Up KODAK

Reviews.Title: Very good camera thus far
Reviews.Author: QBN
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera based on price and the reviews.  So far I've found it to be an excellent product and performing as expected w/o any major problems.  Thus far I am very happy with my purchase and the couple of dozen or so pictures I have taken with this camera have turned out A+++ as far as quality goes - no complaints or adverse issues noted.

Reviews.Title: nice digital camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Quality merchandise for the price I could not beat the item anywhere else, pictures come out clear and flash on dark days works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Please do not buy/pure frustration
Reviews.Author: Naomi
Reviews.Content: I could not upload the software. I tried for hours,went to the Kodak support center. Nothing... They don't even have the software online for the camera. When nothing worked I only had one option: Send it back/piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Apple momma
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice looking camera. I'm looking forward to giving it to my granddaughter  I know she will love it!!

Reviews.Title: Camera is no longer supported
Reviews.Author: Ronald LeJeune
Reviews.Content: You should know that the company no longer supports the cameras and finding the software is impossible,(mine wouldn't load from the camera). A work around is putting in a sdhc card and using a card reader. Other than that the camera is doorstop.

Reviews.Title: as expected, it works, ok, not great
Reviews.Author: Brent J.
Reviews.Content: This is what you'd expect. It works. The pix look fine.  It won't knock your socks off, but for the price... it works.  Very plain.  They should call it the Vanilla camera.

Reviews.Title: Useless software
Reviews.Author: Kelly Miller
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to get the camera, then I tried to load the software that is included and it would not load.  I tried over and over and finally decided to go to the Kodak website for assistance, only to find out that Kodak Easyshare is a discontinued product and they no longer have assistance via web or live person regarding this product.  I am going to return the camera. :(

Reviews.Title: Product recommendation
Reviews.Author: Ender Rafael Guedez Alvarado
Reviews.Content: excellent product easy to handle recommend as it is very good and the person is also very responsible and kind thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Marietta
Reviews.Content: I had both it for my son,and he like it how it work,think u.I think I would but it again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare C195
Reviews.Author: Stanley W. Hadden
Reviews.Content: I love it, and I'm glad I got it.  As my first digital camera I am thoroughly impressed with it.

Reviews.Title: great price great camera
Reviews.Author: Laurent cox
Reviews.Content: excellent camera for first time, small for nice carry on, uses SD memory card any size which is the most versatile card on the market and take great picture for the price

Reviews.Title: Exactly As Described
Reviews.Author: Christina Miller
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandmother, she enjoyed it and the camera works exactly as described so it's perfect for her.

Reviews.Title: KODAK DIGITAL
Reviews.Author: roy bell
Reviews.Content: I CHOSE THIS CAMERA BECAUSE I WANTED TO HAVE A LITTLE POINT AND SHOOT TO TAKE WITH ME ON BIKING TRIPS THAT I DIDNT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT ON THE TRAIL. IT HAS ENOUGH FEATURES TO COVER ALMOST ANY NEED YOU MIGHT HAVE, AND THE PRICE WAS RIGHT.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: John Howell
Reviews.Content: The camera came as described, and we were happy to see some other comments were not entirely accurate:1. There was a cord for connecting the camera to my computer and2. there is software/drivers at Kodak to download.There is not support for the easyshare web access; but with the photos on my computer that doesn't really matter to me - I would rather use my computer software to edit the photos anyway.

Reviews.Title: Didnt hold up to the Kodak name
Reviews.Author: K. C.
Reviews.Content: The batteries after using them once, had a dry white powdery  substance seeping from it.. It was hard to retreive the pics immediately after taking them. The word processing stayed on the screen for along time. Therefore anyone waiting to see their pic usually ended up walking away because it took so long

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: when my family and I went to disneyworld we dropped the camera in a small puddle we thought we were done for but lucky there was no water damage :D

Reviews.Title: No software, can't connect to computer
Reviews.Author: Lou Wallace
Reviews.Content: Amazon why are you selling an unsupported device? Kodak, why wouldn't you at least let us download the last version of the app that allows this camera to communicate with a pc as a storage device?  To still sell a product with this arbitrary limitations put in place is just plain wrong.I have ordered the old style big SD RAM card it requires, which will be the only way to get your pictures. If that even works?

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: MJW "MJW"
Reviews.Content: Great easy to use camera purchased for my 12 year old granddaughter.  Takes very nice pictured and the color was a huge plus away from the norm of silver or black.  She loves it therefore I recommend.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Kathy Jo McCullough
Reviews.Content: do NOT buy this camera, the one I received was faultily.  It would NOT connect to my computer.  They provided NO soft ware and Kodak no longer supports it.  What ever happened to Kodak ??

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Laura Shelton Thykeson "Laura Shelton Thykeson"
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th Kodak Easyshare camera I have owned and I just love this new one! It was a fantastic price, and I already had the software from an earlier version of the same line of cameras and it transfers like a dream!

Reviews.Title: No Luck with my C195
Reviews.Author: Mer

Reviews.Content: I'm not long on reviews so I will say this, great camera for the price & easy to figure out; daughter was sharing pics with her friends in minutes.HOWEVER, it would have been nice to know that Kodak no longer supports sharing to YOUTUBE and a couple of others that it was advertised THAT IT WOULD DO. Reviews.Title: Perfect size

Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for another Camera I had bought that didn't work for a gift for my daughter and her small family...its been perfect!  Its the perfect size to carry and it takes great pictures!  It came quicker than the shipping date had originally stated which was even better!

Reviews.Title: Bad shipping.
Reviews.Author: miko
Reviews.Content: Pros: it's cheap and not bad quality.Cons:Well.. The quality of the handling. I didn't expect I would get a defective product. As soon as I opened it, the screen was cracked.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195 replacing older camera
Reviews.Author: H. Glenn
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera for taking pictures at work.Simple to use, picture quality is very good and love the display screen.

Reviews.Title: Great for everyday use
Reviews.Author: Phree15
Reviews.Content: this camera is for every day use when we don't want to pull out the dsl.  My girlfriend loves it.

Reviews.Title: No Software!  Therefore, no EasyShare.  Otherwise good camera and good value.
Reviews.Author: Janna
Reviews.Content: The software is no longer available.  It does not come with software, but directs you to Kodak's website, which says "KODAK EASYSHARE Software is no longer available as a download. We regret any inconvenience to you."  They stopped supporting the software in March 2013, so why it was still sold as an "easyshare" camera with all the sharing features (email, facebook, etc) for the Christmas 2013 season and beyond is inexcusable.  So, the little red button on the camera for easyshare does nothing because the required software can no longer be downloaded!  (I'm not sure upon more reading that it really did anything besides upload for you...it might not have been that useful anyway.  I don't think it had any intended wireless capability, just uploading to your preferred location when you upload to your computer.)As for ease of use, I got it for my four year old as it is no doubt much higher quality than toy cameras after reading those reviews.  I occasionally even snap a picture with it for myself if I don't have my "real" camera handy.  The picture quality is not exceptional but probably quite good for the level camera it is.  There are very few buttons and options and a nice large screen, which is what I wanted for my four year old.  She really enjoys it and figured out how to use it and see her pictures right away. One thing I like is that the flash is easy to turn off when you need to (button dedicated to flash - not buried in a menu).If it weren't for the misleading marketing and I was taking price into account, I would give it a pretty high rating because it is an easy to use camera and it was very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: takes good pictures.
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Littau
Reviews.Content: will not load software to my computer.  even got software disk!!!!!!!!!!  would like help to make camera or memory card work.  THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Christen M. Allen
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is a very nice point and shoot camera. However, I was very disappointed to learn (after receiving the camera) that Kodak no longer supports the Easyshare software, which renders this selling point null. The sharing process has to be accomplished by whatever software is currently on your computer, so the 'share' button on the camera is much less useful than I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: The Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera takes excellent pictures!
Reviews.Author: Sheryl H.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASYSHARE

I still haven't checked to see if It is or isn't available. Be aware though that this camera blows through batteries and comes with an internal storage capacity of only five photos so i added an SD card and some rechargeable batteries. Great starter camera!

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift

Reviews.Title: good product

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare c195 Camera

Reviews.Title: Camera

Reviews.Content: Thought I ordered a camera with more megapixels, however it takes good pictures. Put new batteries in and it said they were dead after 5 pictures. That will be a pain to keep batteries in if that's how its going to be.

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera.

Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my grand daughter. She says she loves it because she can take great pictures. She says it's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera

Reviews.Content: Camera came just as described works great and Mom loved it as her present. I would recommend getting some rechargable batteries

Reviews.Title: Love it!
