Reviews.Title: Software is not supported
Reviews.Author: Sister Mary Kelly
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my father Christmas 2013. I selected this camera because it was supposed to allow upload of photos to Facebook, Flickr, etc. with the push of a button. When we went to install the software via the KODAK website we received an error because 'the software is no longer supported'.  The Kodak website states "KODAK EASYSHARE Software is no longer available as a download. We regret any inconvenience to you"um, yeah, I DO find it inconvenient that the product was advertised with features that it does not have.Next step is to find out whether to return the thing to Kodak or to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: kodak
Reviews.Author: maria kourkouliotis
Reviews.Content: Got this for my niece she is still unsure of it, doesn't care of the pixel color but for the most part good camera to start with.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use for the not so tech-savvy!
Reviews.Author: tkhatatba "TK"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend's mom for Christmas because she had a super outdated digital camera (the kind without a flash that has a mini screen and like one button). She loves taking pictures but very few were usable with this crappy camera so she was losing some memorable moments.She is older and not tech-savvy at all! She has a flip cell phone and an @aol email address (hopefully that paints the picture I am trying to show you) so I knew I had to be careful with the next camera she would own.This really was the perfect option for her to be honest:1. It is inexpensive, good to give as a gift for someone that doesn't care about the latest technology or the hottest brand.2. It is nice and simple, she wanted a camera to simple do "camera things" and doesn't need to extras. The buttons are basic and it is easy to see what each of them do. Also, the screen is nice and big so she can see the pictures clearly.3. So easy to use, I gave her a tutorial on the camera when she opened it. I told her how to use the flash, how to focus when taking a picture, zoom, and how to view the pictures. This only took a few minutes and she totally understood.4. Small and light weight, good for traveling. She went on a cruise with the camera and there was not a bunch of equipment to carry around.I looked at the pictures after the cruise and it seems like she remembered the tutorial I gave her. The pictures were clear and she had snapped pics of everything!!! She was so exited about the clarity of the pictures that she did not want to miss out on anything.This camera does however use AA batteries. You can buy a rechargeable one if you want but I just got her a pack of batteries to go with it. Since she was traveling, especially internationally, I wasn't sure if she would always have access to an outlet in order to charge it so the batteries were actually a good thing!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: bashfulfarmboy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, compact which makes it easy to carry, takes an excellent picture and easy to review taken pictures

Reviews.Title: Not worth the sale price
Reviews.Author: L. Schneider
Reviews.Content: Photos are hit and miss in terms of whether they are clear and focused.  For the price, it's ok to buy for a child as a toy camera, but don't have high expectations of this camera if you're buying for yourself.  Very disappointed.  I'm giving it to my son and buying something else.

Reviews.Title: good pictures
Reviews.Author: sandra l battle
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and I like the fact that you use batteries instead of chargng it. I can just take the batteries out and put in new ones.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a Christmas gift as I have one. Mine is 4 years old and still works like new. No problems.It arrived very fast and was exactly as described. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Ripped off buyKodak again
Reviews.Author: marty
Reviews.Content: This camera software will not work on any of my computers and when you check on line with Kodak it says they no longer offer downloads or tech support for this product. I should have known better I already bought one of their printers. The wifi never works and although the ink is cheap you run out after very few prints.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Sher
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for day to day home photos. Picture quality is very good. Easy to setup and use. Thanks Kodak

Reviews.Title: Many, many positive points and features, but it has one disturbing flaw.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "cluckbang"
Reviews.Content: For the capability and features, this camera cannot be beat.  You can read about them in other reviews.  Once one gains familiarity with its use, it becomes easy to operate.My one serious complaint is the clarity of the pictures.  For a 14 megapixel camera I would expect to see more and more detail as I blow the picture up.  With the C195, I do, but as I reach the point where I should start seeing clear individual pixels, I instead see a fuzzy, blurry unclear image. Individual pixels are not clearly visible.  (I experimented with a tripod and delayed image capture to prevent any possibility of inadvertent motion or shaking.)  I don't know the exact reason for this problem.  It could be compromised lens, CDD card or even the compression formula for the JPEG images, but whatever the cause, it is wasting its high stated megapixel capability.  It may as well be a 5 megapixel camera.It's really a shame as I like so many other things about this little camera.4/4/2014 - Apparently even Kodak won't support this loser with its download EasyShare software any longer.  If they don't believe in their product, why should I?  I'm dropping my stars to just 1 from 3.

Reviews.Title: Overall great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Mike Kendall
Reviews.Content: Great camera for our 11 year old daughter! Only negative is the low battery life. Recommend rechargeable batteries or lithium batteries.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase of the Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera ; )
Reviews.Author: Rosella McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. Great at capturing moving objects, not one bit blurry. I'm so chuffed with my purchase and would highly recommend this camera. Only a slight downfall is the batteries don't last too long, but i always carry spares just incase. ; ) Love it !!!!

Reviews.Title: Happy Kodak User
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I had owned a Kodak Z730 since 2006.  It was a great camera and we used it for everything, but finally one of the kids dropped it just right and broke it.  So when it came time to buy a new one we looked around and read to the reviews.  We decided to go with another Kodak,  if your camera last almost 8 years it seems like a good thing to consider, and this one fit our budget and our needs.  After receiving it in the mail I was extremely happy with it.  the picture Quality is great and because I had owned a Kodak before It was not difficult to use.  I just hope this one will last us another 8 years.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase of the Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera ; )
Reviews.Author: Rosella McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. Great at capturing moving objects, not one bit blurry. I'm so chuffed with my purchase and would highly recommend this camera. Only a slight downfall is the batteries don't last too long, but i always carry spares just incase. ; ) Love it !!!!

Reviews.Title: Happy Kodak User
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I had owned a Kodak Z730 since 2006.  It was a great camera and we used it for everything, but finally one of the kids dropped it just right and broke it.  So when it came time to buy a new one we looked around and read to the reviews.  We decided to go with another Kodak,  if your camera last almost 8 years it seems like a good thing to consider, and this one fit our budget and our needs.  After receiving it in the mail I was extremely happy with it.  the picture Quality is great and because I had owned a Kodak before It was not difficult to use.  I just hope this one will last us another 8 years.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Carrol Venable
Reviews.Content: Not big and bulky. Perfect size with easy to read directions. Very happy with this camera!! Easy to use and takes clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: perfect for my grandson
Reviews.Author: MarionZambory
Reviews.Content: I didn't take out of the package but the instructions are clear.. and he can easily handle it and download to the computer

Reviews.Title: Great for low light areas
Reviews.Author: Carla W Stacy
Reviews.Content: Takes really good pictures! In a dim lit room with the flash takes amazing pictures. I was very surprised. Great price too!

Reviews.Title: Not as easy as I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: ilona harris
Reviews.Content: Difficult to figure out how to actually share photos...not sure I'm happy with product. Instructions not easy to follow at all. Disappointed

Reviews.Title: It's a  great Camera
Reviews.Author: Treasia Guy
Reviews.Content: I like being able to send pictures to face book and Family without having to down load in the computer.

Reviews.Title: No Soft where, but it did take good pictures
Reviews.Author: Roger B.
Reviews.Content: There was NO soft where with camera to down load pictures to my computer, Direction the camera need to be more user friendly amazon did a great job on the shipping and delivery as explained when purchased.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195 Digital Camera (Red)
Reviews.Author: A. L. Anderson
Reviews.Content: The camera itself was great, but I had a hard time finding and obtaining the associated software. Also, I had an easier time getting my pictures from an earlier model of the same camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam,just what I wanted!!!!
Reviews.Author: Knice30
Reviews.Content: The camera feel cheaply made. But works as discribed. All functions is as it seems.  The color was on point. So over all the camera is productive

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: BrittyBrit
Reviews.Content: It does the job "capture the moment" , but I wouldn't say it has very good quality pictures. It is easy to share pictures, but its not just a click of a button. You have to download a software first. Choose it on the camera and then go to the software and upload it, honestly if it wasn't too late I would return it!

Reviews.Title: You get what you paid for...
Reviews.Author: Chandika Annasiwatta
Reviews.Content: Basic point and shoot camera. This is what you can expect for price you paid. Working ok. If you are looking for low price option, this may be right for you.

Reviews.Title: Camera is a disappointment.
Reviews.Author: Carmen L Rexach Rosales & Adrian Pons
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this Kodak Camera. If you lower the megapixels by half the picture becomes grainy amd the colors become too pale. I had always owned an EasyShare camera, but this time I am completely dissapointed by the quality of this product.

Reviews.Title: i want to return the camera
Reviews.Author: Betty Hamlin
Reviews.Content: I was unable to figure out how to use this camera even though I owned a esay share kodak camera previouslyI was unable to get help off of the kodack easy share help line eitherI want to return it

Reviews.Title: camera was not in working order when i received it.
Reviews.Author: Martha Cleveland
Reviews.Content: camera did not work lens would not open so I was not allowed to use the camera. I also was not satisfied with the color I had to change colors when I ordered another one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera.
Reviews.Author: Pablo Blanco
Reviews.Content: Gave it as a gift and the recipient loves it.  It is easy to use and takes absolutely lovely pictures all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: It is the easiest camera that I have owned.  It is so fun to just turn on and shoot a picture or make a video.  I have been having a lot of fun taking pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: chevy is 1 "ELVIS"
Reviews.Content: Kodak Easy share C195 Digital Camera (Silver)  this is nice camera my grand dauter loves it good job ..thanks ...ken../

Reviews.Title: Shame on Kodak
Reviews.Author: Connie Anderson
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine, but when I use the cable to transfer to computer, It knocks my computer down.  I have to use the card to transfer.  Kodak doesn't support the software (already).  If you don't have the little card slot in your computer you're out of luck.

Reviews.Title: Camera is doing its job
Reviews.Author: Catlover
Reviews.Content: The camera is meeting my needs.  However, I do not like the fact that it does not have a rechargeable battery like my other Kodak Easyshare.  Also the USB cord that came with my camera did not let me download my pictures to the computer so I had to purchase a memory card reader.  Other than that the pictures come out clear and the camera is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Buy
Reviews.Author: Keith Campbell "Keith Campbell"
Reviews.Content: The C195 camera we got from Amazon takes great photos and cannot be matched for the price.  Kodak has superb technology and it is a shame that the economy is so bad that Kodak has financial problems which has forced them to curtail the great support previously provided a few years ago when we got another great Kodak camera.  For instanced free software for uploading photos is no longer available and is not needed if you remove the memory chip and plug it into your computer.  The memory chip is no longer included with the camera but an 8 GB one may be purchased from Wal-Mart for under $10 or from Amazon for less.  This chip will store up to about 9,900 photos depending on the fidelity you select on the C195.  The camera + chip for under $55 is an incredible buy.  We highly recommend the C195 as a low-cost-option.

Reviews.Title: no software
Reviews.Author: cait
Reviews.Content: there is no disk or software included, I have no way to get photos off the camera and the photos are grainy low quality, color is slightly off. I want my money back but I guess now I have to pay shipping to return it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA @ AN INEXPENSIVE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Kevin James Nichols
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA REALLY DOES TAKE GREAT PICTURES!! I HAD A KODAK CAMERA C182 BEFORE THIS ONE, & LOVED IT TOO; THIS ONE HAS A SLIGHTLY SMALLER BODY TO IT, IT ALWAYS TAKES A MOMENT FOR THE AUTO FOCUS TO LOCK IN, BUT OVERALL A REALLY VERSATILE CAMERA......AND YOU CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE!!!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: Shopper "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera, but not a good one either.  If you are willing to put up with some blurry pictures, this camera will do for you.  If, on the other hand, you want to shoot a picture with confidence, buy up.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: LESLE GIBSON
Reviews.Content: I Did not realize this camera took AA batteries. I find this inconvenient but like the camera other than that.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share C195
Reviews.Author: Judy Loiselle
Reviews.Content: I have ALWAYS loved Kodak Easy Share cameras.  They take really beautiful photos and the click time is fast and quick.I never miss a great shot!!  I have gotten some professional quality photos using my Kodak Easy Share! I always carry it in my pocketbook!!! LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: KATMAN
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and really takes wonderful photos i highly recommend it if your looking for a cheap good camera

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Donna Giardina Shump "Donna Giardina Shump"
Reviews.Content: I really love the camera and am enjoying using it.  The pictures are turning out great and it is a great camera

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Trinab35
Reviews.Content: I had another model easy share that I liked better but this one is a good little carry around camera for everyday use.  It's easy to use and creates pretty good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size camera
Reviews.Author: Shelley Ritter
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect size.  It works great and takes great looking pictures too.  Perfect size for carrying in a purse.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Santos Alcorta
Reviews.Content: I really like my camera, it is what i wanted.  The price was what made me buy it. I needed it and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera but I "lost " some photos.
Reviews.Author: Paul Rieckmann
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera. It is easy to use, has some good features, (that I will never use), and a low price. Last year in New Orleans at Mardi Gras on Fat Tuesday I aws taking photos at the parade. For some reason the camera stopped taking pictures which I did not notice it at first and I lost some great photos. I was angry to say the least. Kodak tech support claims that they should still be in the camera but I have no idea on how to retrieve them.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195 camera
Reviews.Author: gloria sabandal
Reviews.Content: I loved it.I had purchase this camera before and it came with the SanDIsk 4GB......However this camera did not have it and I had to go buy one,before trying it out....Glo.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195 Camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Harrell
Reviews.Content: I like the camera very much.  The batteries that came with the cameras lasted only a short while, ut when I used new batteries the camera works well.

Reviews.Title: good workhorse w/ issues
Reviews.Author: Light Stream
Reviews.Content: The camera functions fine.  It takes good pictures.  It's movies are of OK quality, but not good in the dark.  The camera, when taking video, always has a red light on.  It's very bright.  It will put a big red dot on your face if it's too close.There are no options in regards to video format.  I'd like to take a video at 10 frames per second.  Maybe w/ 8-bit color.  I'd like to choose the resolution of the audio-storage as well.  I'd like to be able to make this video-recorder make a 3 hour video, if the batteries could last that long.  The batteries die out quick.  I open the battery case, when not in use, so they don't drain.  I use 1.2 volt NiMh batteries and they work OK.  I could probably take 20 pictures before they need to be recharged.Now the screen cover did crack.  another user reported the same problem & gave it a 1 rating.  The front eye-lid is supposed to auto-open & close.  Mine is stuck sometimes.  I have to open it w/ my finger... But I can still use it.  Again, another user had the same problem.  My equipment takes a beating.  I guess I'm luck it works at all.It's user-friendly & intuitive enough.  No complaints there at all.  I don't mind having to use my fingernail to turn it on or off.  No big problem.  But I don't like having to enter in the date or click serveral buttons to get out of that menu, every time I turn the camera on (as I said, I open the battery door when not in use, so this effects that), still.  It's redundant and takes up time.So, overall, it's a good camera, but, I sincerely wish they had the features I want, that I named above, that they don't have.  I dont mind the crack...  I can work around it.  It's a good work horse, but it has major issues, and if it had a flexible audio/picture compression... settings, it would be much better, but few cameras have that as an option.

Reviews.Title: DIGITAL CAMERA FOR NOVICES
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Norman
Reviews.Content: This camera is good! Have used 2 Kodak cameras for many years, like 11 years, having 5 and 7 MPs and wanted new technology since started having problems with the 5MP one. PICTURE QUALITY IS GREAT. The connection between uploading pictures to computer is good, an area I usually have a rough time with in other cameras less expensive.  The deletion feature is excellent, the best!  For me, the memory card is not necessary at all.  The price is extremely reasonable for the features it offers. ONLY WORRY IS KODAK IS GOING OUT OF DIGITAL CAMERA BUSINESS. I recommend it to all amateurs on a limited budget.  I use it for taking photos of my puppies who move fast and this camera keeps up with them! Never a blur. That is one of the BEST features!  I moreso admire deeply the Nikon COOLPIX L26 that is sooo easy to use in ALL respects and priced a bit higher for those wanting the very BEST without paying thousands of dollars!

Reviews.Title: made a convert out of a film camera user!
Reviews.Author: ann richter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to get me through a vacation as my current long used and well - loved 35mm film camera needed some repair that I was too lazy to get done before the trip.  A co-worker recommended this camera and I love it!  It did everything it said and more.  I was so impressed by the photo quality, the editing functions, the video and audio - everything!And it's purple-my favorite color.1

Reviews.Title: Nice, inexpensive compact camera
Reviews.Author: C. Alarcon "Master Uchual"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera (refurbished) for less than $60. We are leaving for a week vacation to Maui, and I decided that my Pentax K-x 12.4MP Digital SLR with 2.7 inch LCD and 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AL Lens (Red) is too bulky to take to the trip, and my old Canon SD300 4MP is not up to the challenge for outdoor pics, thus I took a chance on this camera. So far, the test pics under various conditions have come nice. The photos show good resolution and colour balance. One star demerit for the small buttons, not good for a thick finger guy like myself. I'll update more after returning from the trip, which I believe would be a real trial for this little camera. Cheers.Update - 08 April 2012- Well, this little camera showed initially lots of promise, but I must say I am, in general, quite disappointed about the quality of the photographs. For a 14 MP camera, the photo quality is just average. That goes for an inexpensive camera, so I guess that was kind of expected. As a regular point and shoot, it goes well with most situations. Do not expect big things of this camera, and you won't be disappointed as I was.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: I love it! It has different frames (like if your taking pictures of fireworks, it has a special option so it won't blur.) so it really helps! It has 5x zoom which is really cool, and I already had a tripod and it fit :) Only thing is, I bought mine used so it didn't come with batteries or anything, just a camera.  It shipped in 3 days (I picked standard 3-5 days) as early as it could and was pretty much brand new.

Reviews.Title: about  the camera my wife wanted.
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: The camera is as good as expected. Has not gave any trouble and takes clear very good pictures. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ZSandyL
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 13 year old daughter and she loves it!We had a little problem with Kodak before though. We purchased this camera exactly one year ago, and a couple months ago, it stopped working, so we sent it into Kodak to get it fixed up. They said since it is still under the year warranty we can fix it or send you a new one. Weeks later, my husband got a email attached with pictures of my daughters camera. The screenwas white w/ a black hole and the lens was completely ripped off. My husband sent back a complaint and said that is not how it was shipped. We got a email back weeks later saying that this camera was not in a listing of a warranty and that this was disrespectful to there company. So as you can see, they did not promise to send us a new camera or reepair the old camera as we thought in the email. Now we are purchasing a new one because my daughter loves it and says she llikes this camera the best!I do believe this camera takes some of the best pictures. It has high quality pictures, easy share for facebook, twitter etc, many different options such as black and white, a timer to set pictures up to, and a very clear sports mode. The sports mode pictures are unbelievable. My daughter and her friend were jumping on the bed posing like 3 feet in the air, and I have to say, as an adult, I am very impressed.I am very impressed with Koadak cameras but not with there service that they contributed to my daughters camera.I recommend to anyone that has a cheap budget but wants a very well-doing camera!

Reviews.Title: Great  Pictures to taken with ease o
Reviews.Author: Russ Renaud
Reviews.Content: Great little camera that takes wonferfully vivid and clear pictures.and it's so easy to use. And the price is right. It's so simple to use.If there is a problem at all. the power on/off swith is difficilt to push on and off due to the size of the button and the fact that it is recessed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera -- easy to use, nice features
Reviews.Author: Pam Saalfeld
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was easy to use and was capable of taking excellent low-light and night shots.  As my daughter and I travel a lot and many places in Europe have very low light, this was essential.  This camera has two excellent settings for this:  a specific night-shot feature and high ISO feature, either of which will function well.  The 5X zoom brings images from a distance in and keeps them sharp and clear.  Another plus -- the landscape feature!  Very nice.  And as it is purple, my favorite color, I found a camera case that is also purple. I couldn't be more please!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Carrolyn
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for a Christmas gift. I have to say I love it. I have taken so many pictures, and they have all turned out great. I am new to using digital, but it has been ab easy learning experience. Thank you to my wonderful hubby for this gift.

Reviews.Title: Does everything I want it to do
Reviews.Author: Lolo1366 "Lori"
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. I purchased this camera while visiting Charleston, SC. The only issue I have had so far, is that I sometimes end up with blurry shots. This is because I don't always let the camera focus because I am in a hurry to get the shot. This is MY fault, not the camera itself.The camera does tend to eat battery quickly, but using Lithium batteries has made a tremendous difference in the amount of battery life I get in the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: VIDEO MODE*Noisy lens for video*Annoying red light*480p quality... could have been 720p, most point and shoot cameras have that.*It was good that the videos are .avi files.*Zooming in while filming reduces the quality significantlyPICTURESOVERALL: 2/5*A nice 14 MP*It usually doesn't take blurry photos, but there is a lot of motion blur.*Flash sometimes makes the background black when shot in low light.OVERALL: I like the pictures, but sometimes the flash is horrible indoors.OVERALL: 4/5SHARE BUTTON*You have to plug in the camera to your computer using the USB cable. This was a big disappointment.CAMERA'S OVERALL SCORE: 3/5

Reviews.Title: Kodak C-195
Reviews.Author: Cdrom58
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived very quickly.It was in new condition as promised. Takes great pictures.Very easy to use.Would recommend and will use this order system again.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality For Budget Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bobaroo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an inexpensive carry camera for my pocket as my crossover was too bulky to toss in my cargo shorts and my old Canon pocket was, well, outdated with 8MP. I was very surprised at the great image quality of this Kodak C195 including low-light pics. You have an easy to use 'smart' setting and can pick other preset settings that have text descriptions for each one so this camera is very easy to use. Very much a true point and shoot camera. I used the video setting and that worked pretty well too. Large LCD screen, strong flash, quick face recognition, very simple controls. Not an ultra-compact but small enough to fit in a loose pocket or purse. It uses 2 AA batteries and can go trough them quickly so have extras around or  use lithium batteries. For the money this camera is a great value!

Reviews.Title: Blury photos/defective unit
Reviews.Author: west
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived in a box that was smashed!Gave it a try and noticed a 1/4 strip on some of the photos once printed.Also many of the photos taken indoors were blurry.My old cannon thats 6 years old takes much better quality photos.We returned the camera for full credit. The seller and Amazon were very good throughout the return process.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures, Love automatic functions
Reviews.Author: MGKerri
Reviews.Content: I really like the automatic features on this camera.  On my old Kodak, I had to manually change from action shots, to landscape, to close-up, etc.  This camera just does it.  That's the best part.  I like the look and feel of the camera.  It has virtually NO internal memory, however, and it goes through batteries kind of fast.  But it does take GORGEOUS pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for My Teenager
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to my daughter for her 16th birthday and she loves it.  It's cute (purple) and it is very easy for her to upload her pictures to Facebook.  She takes it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: thumper
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! I absolutely LOVE this camera-GREAT purchase easy to use/set up. clear screen the whole nine yard's. The camera is absolutely BEAUTIFULL!!

Reviews.Title: Re-Furbished Camera
Reviews.Author: MagicFox
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip that I was going on with my family.  Back screen was great and camera worked fine for the first 2 days..but then the lens would not re-tract and it stopped taking pictures..I lost out on a lot of good photo opportunities...however the company was awesome in having me ship back item for full credit.  Wished they sold new cameras would have bought one from them!

Reviews.Title: A great camera - Initially
Reviews.Author: J. Black
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this camera, it was easy to use.  Great looking pic and video resolution.  Then, with no warning, the camera 'froze' and would no longer turn on.  I have tried different batteries and took it to the store where I purchased it to see if someone could figure out what went wrong.  They could not.  Long story/short - the camera worked for about 6 months, then died.

Reviews.Title: kodak easyshare digital camera
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: excelant camera with its 5 times optical zome and with easyshare for any photos you want to down load onto computer to share with other people very simple to use as well

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195 Camera
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I am a 73 yr old man, and I like  taking pictures of grand kids and great grand kids.I had a easyshare camera before and loved how easy it is to use.This one is great but the buttons are to small for my big fingers.It takes beautifal pictures and is easy to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: upon reading reviews,i bought the lithum batteries,hard camera case,and then i bought the easy to use+wire computer to camera+takes great amature pictures*did not drop the camera*its great thanks to every one *oh yes iadded the 4g chip

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195 camera
Reviews.Author: Billy R. Hicks "ksoldier"
Reviews.Content: This camera is working just fine, and doing what I purchased it for. I hope to continue using the camera, and enjoying the results, as I have already.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, few shortcomings
Reviews.Author: dontknowwhattonameme
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera - very easy to learn to use.  There are a few shortcomings, though.  When filming, once you zoom in, you can't zoom back out.  This can be frustrating.  Also, if you're expecting a great picture at a distance when filming, this is not the camera for you.  However, it is FANTASTIC for filming within 6 feet or so (perhaps more, I haven't yet tried).  One other annoying (for me) factor is it won't save your last setting once you power off.  Meaning, if I have it in video filming mode and I turn the camera off, I still have to change it to video filming mode when I turn it back on again.  Same with other settings as well.  This can be a bit annoying when taking the same type of photos.  Having said all that, the picture-from-video feature and "action" photos from video feature are AWESOME (though I wish you could use these features from the Kodak software on the computer instead of ONLY on the camera itself), and the photo quality is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera While it worked,
Reviews.Author: GaryMickel
Reviews.Content: Got 6-8 good photo's from this camera before it broke on me and when it broke I was useing it for the modt important photo's I have taken.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195 <Refurb>
Reviews.Author: A. Fierman
Reviews.Content: As a semi professional photographer, this is one of the best point and shoots that I have owned to date.  The ease of set up and versatility is at the top of the scale.  Battery life is good compared to others.  Although it is a point and shoot, the auto focus is a great feature.  Most of these cameras are either bought for children but the C195 takes great images and can be proudly carried by adults as well.  This C195 I have is taking the place of three other cameras that I have.  Close ups, portraits and landscapes are at the top of the chart.  Takes better pictures than my more expensive models.  If set up correctly, rivals some of the professional models on the market today.  UPDATE:  My son went on a European vacation and took this little guy with him.  Batteries were not a problem at all.  "AA" are easy to find even in Russia and Ukraine.  Every shot he took came out great.  There were no swirls and the image stabilation works great.  It is just a shame that Kodak did not get on board with the digital camera when it started taking over from the film that they basically invented.  Kodak is still in business for its film products.  When this one breaks down, if it ever does, will have to circular file it.  It is a shame.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Irunalone
Reviews.Content: Nice camera - nice price.  So far so good - although I did buy rechargeable batteries as I felt they ran out too quickly.  Zooms in good..

Reviews.Title: Cheap and it shows!
Reviews.Author: AM "am amazon"
Reviews.Content: I knew going from a Canon to Kodak would be a mistake but for the price, I was willing to to take a chance.This is a nice camera for the money but it's the little things that matter. My first Kodak camera has been a disappointment. The pictures are good and the video is smooth.Now for the problems ...The playback sound of the video is very low.The rotary selector dial on the Cannon was very easy to use but on the C195, you have to use a button to get to various presets like scenes and video mode.Purple streaks show up on the LCD when the camera is pointed to bright light or sunlight. This is only a viewfinder problem and does not affect the pictures. But again this problem was never seen on my Cannon or Olympus cameras.The biggest problem that my wife sees is that you cannot review the pictures or the video without turning on the camera, having the lens protrude out and only then the review or play button works! This little lack of thought or foresight on the part of Kodak shows why Canon products (like Apple's products) are a better choice if you can afford it.I'm debating whether to return this camera and I am a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great simple camera
Reviews.Author: S. Moritz "moritznet"
Reviews.Content: After having several cameras that this operator couldn't manage, this little kodak is terrific.  It has enough zoom, good battery life, (and batteries are readily available) and makes it easy to download the pictures.  I'm kicking myself for suffering with the more expensive and less useful cameras.

Reviews.Title: Quality of photos high; frustration with camera higher
Reviews.Author: D.J.
Reviews.Content: The photos, once taken, are high quality and look nice even when blown up.  Operating the camera, however, is very frustrating.  It has no view-finder, so you have to set your shot on the screen.  No problem with the first shot, but then the shot you just took stays on the screen for a very long time (probably close to 10 actual seconds), which means you cannot take another shot until it clears, or you take one and just guess what is in the frame.  (I have tried to find a way to clear out the first shot so I can set up the next one, but have not been able to do it.)  I have an eight month old child and to get nice shots you need to shoot repeatedly while she is moving and hope to catch a good one here and there. This camera is not at all suited for that.  Also, there is a marked delay between depressing the button and the photo taking.  Most times, what I see on the screen when I take the shot (which then goes black) is nothing close to what is actually photographed when the screen lights up again.  I cannot imagine any reason for such a delay.  If you are in to still photography, this would be a fine camera.  If you are photographing anything that moves (people, pets, etc . . .) this camera is not for you.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C195 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Coe
Reviews.Content: I received this camera within 5 days of placing the order with FREE SHIPPING option! Very pleased with the delivery time and the product itself. This camera performs with anything out there! Beautiful colors. Great resolution. Easy to use. What else could you ask for out of a 'point and shoot' camera for under $70! I love this camera and hope to get many years and memories from its great performance. This C195 is my third Kodak 'point and shoot' digital camera. All have performed very well. Try one!

Reviews.Title: Crazy for Kodak
Reviews.Author: Bible Bookworm
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth or fifth Kodak EasyShare camera. I've used them professionally and this is my first personal one. Thanks Kodak for such an easy camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195, Love It
Reviews.Author: Traci
Reviews.Content: I had an old Kodak camera that took the big memory card, I had to replace it as the pictures were low quality for enlarging or other items.  I shopped around and I found this camera, and I love it!  Besides being purple (my favorite color) it is 14mp with 5X optical zoom and a 3" LCD screen.  I really like the face recognition that this camera has, it helps take much better photos of people.  I love how crystal clear my pictures are when I upload them to my computer and print them out!  I have not used the easyshare to facebook yet,but I love this camera and I am happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: kodak C195
Reviews.Author: bobbby b.
Reviews.Content: great product for the price, fast service as advertized, I added a 2G memory card from best buy for $7.50

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS
Reviews.Author: Eileen T. Lombardi "bugs bunny"
Reviews.Content: for the smallest camera the best zoom great pixels and i can write where i am so i dont have to figure it out woould recommed to anyone

Reviews.Title: Nice little Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Dillman
Reviews.Content: We have a big Nikon 3100 - this little Kodak is my 'throw it in my purse and go' camera.  Takes great pictures....only downfall...the batteries go pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Arizona Gal
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd easyshare camera we have purchased.  This is a birthday gift for my Granddaughter, who will be 7.  It is so easy to use and she kept using mine, so I bought her her very own and now I can use mine.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera.
Reviews.Author: jeff rodman "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for the price. The picture quality is GREAT but the one downside is that the battery life is very short.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: woofNbark
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera after Christmas.  Have used it several times and the pictures are great.  Glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: LW
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to this camera for Christmas, and LOVE IT! If you are looking for a first time digital camera this is the one, so easy to use, would be a great buy for any age. I also purchased the Universal Camera Case and Sandisk 4GB Secure Digital SD HC Memory Card as well. The Memory Card is a MUST have, otherwise you can only take a couple pictures before you run out of memory (only downfall of this camera, but I would imagine thats with all cameras)

Reviews.Title: Kodak c195
Reviews.Author: T. Thomas
Reviews.Content: My daughter LOVES this camera. I bought it for her for Christmas and the fact that it was purple was a bonus! It takes great pictures and the 3 inch screen makes viewing them even better. She loves the face detection and other features because she is always taking pictures of herself. The price was great just wish it came with a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, I can't require anything else
Reviews.Author: Ernesto Segura
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I love the the picture quality. I dont have any problem with the menu or buttons size. I hate the internal battery becouse in a travel I can't recharge it and this camera don't have it

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C195
Reviews.Author: T. Gray
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who will be studying abroad in Ireland.. It was really easy for her to use.  She just loves it.  Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed, Frustrated, no software or support from Kodak
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "kgorski"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after researching what I thought quit well. Now that I have it and tried to download the software and share photos I get a script error and Kodak no longer offers the download or support. Waste of money, but it is a Beautiful camera and takes great pictures - I can only view them by removing the memory card and putting it directly into the computer. How and why can/do they sell/allow to be sold new merchandise with No type of support or means to use it to the full functioning capabilities? don't waste your money, unless you don't want to use all of the functions it is to have!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak c135
Reviews.Author: Manda Jenks
Reviews.Content: Please do NOT buy this camera.  You have to MANUALLY date stamp each of your pictures.  I tried and tried to follow their instructions for date stamping and finally called one of their tech reps to talk me through it, only to find out that this camera does not have the automatic feature.  So when you read their product description telling you that it has "date stamping", remember that you have to do it yourself--manually--for each picture. (Incidentally, even their own on-line instructions for this model provide you pictures of a menu for setting automatic date stamping.  Unfortunately, that menu is not even on the actual camera.)

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195 Digital Camera (Blue)
Reviews.Author: The Undertaker
Reviews.Content: The major draw-back to this camera is that there is an extended delay after taking a picture before it is ready for the next pic. This gets really annoying when I am taking more than one pic and the subjects have to stand there posing for about 10s before the camera is ready again. Also, it sucks that ths camera uses batteries, its best to get a camera that has USB charge.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195 Digital Camera (Purple)
Reviews.Author: wwjd4u
Reviews.Content: Very nice portable camera.  After much comparison with new cameras on the market, this camera was an excellent fit for my daughter for Christmas.  The Kodak EasyShare C195 Digital Camera has the most to offer and a very reasonable price.  Of course, my daughter won't receive her Christmas present until Christmas, I know she is just going to love all the capabilities this camera has to offer.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: mildred
Reviews.Content: takes good pictures I like the design but do not have a problem if it's only mine or about all, no batteries pays for many time you install new batteries packs the same company kodak unworn and did not last 45 minutes when batteries and the same step had exhausted that are included with the purchase of other product I have quueja product just battery run out too soon and did not manage to take photos or 20 when I have to replace it with other batteries .. ..

Reviews.Title: Photo savvy:DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: Just what I needed
Reviews.Content: I have and still use my 35mm auto/manual focus FILM camera. I love it, despite the length to see my results. I got this camera to capture and share holiday moments of me and my 4 year old.As I see that most reviews were posted over 2 years ago, I'm an idiot for wasting my money on this piece of ....All but 2 of my first pics were blurry.Then "Easyshare" is not so easy. There is no longer any software to download to even set up the sharing options.All of the links I click on, sends me to "contact support" and "sorry for the inconvenience."I'm so glad I tested it before I took irreplaceable photos. But both Amazon and kodak need to take these off the market or be honest upfront.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jeanine Gibbs "jeanineg"
Reviews.Content: I have owned two other Easy Share Kodak cameras and was always very happy with them.  However, this camera has left a bad taste in my mouth.  First, the buttons are hard to press. Second, the camera either responds too slowly after a button is pressed or too quickly when scrolling the menu.  The quality of the pictures has been good, but an older version made better pictures.  The same can be said for the videos (about the same quality as a FLIP video)--AND my videos have no sound!  I've downloaded and played from my computer as well as photobucket and there is no sound at all.  This camera has great "perks"--it's a shame it just doesn't work very well.  I'll be returning it today. I don't plan to give up on Easy Share, though--just this crappy version of it!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for a grandaughter
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: Grandaughter wanted a "purple camera" and she was thrilled when she received it.  Easy to use for a 10 year old and she has it with her all of the time.  Excellent picture quality.  It would have been even better, if a camera case came with it.

Reviews.Title: I liked it but it wouldn't work
Reviews.Author: Happy Cooker
Reviews.Content: First, I was most disappointed with the shade of red.  It looks like candy apple red in the photos and wasn't what I expected.  I really liked the camera and wanted it to work.  Called Kodak's tech support as face recognition would not work.  The video looked great....but thereis no sound on playback....only if you're connected to your Mac or PC.  I thought it was easy to use and the directions were clear butI sent it back for a refund to amazon.comAfter reviewing cameras on line and the current issue of Consumer Reports, ordered from amazon.com the highly recommended Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD.  It doesn't have face recognition but with iPhoto I wouldn't use it anyway.  The video is great, too, and you can review your video and hear the sound!I don't know why the other reviewer didn't return it if s/he wasn't happy with it for a full refund.  Amazon's wonderful with customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Stinks!!!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This is without reservation, the WORST camera that I have ever purchased! I previously owned 2 Kodak "point and shoot" digital cameras and loved them both. This one, however, is impossible to use. The pictures are great, but trying to download them to your computer is a nightmare! Using either the card or internal memory, I couldn't get my pics downloaded to at least 2 different editing programs that I commonly use. I called "Customer Support" and spent ALMOST AN ENTIRE DAY "chatting" with them and yet, they couldn't solve my problem. Obviously, this was NOT operator error! They were patient, but MY patience ran out the longer the "chat" went on. Late in the afternoon, I was exhausted and asked that an agent call me in the morning. They said that they COULD NOT make outbound calls, even considering the lengthy discussion that we already had!!!! Speaking of the memory card, when you attempt to get it out of the camera, the batteries fall out and by the way, the camera eats batteries, BIG time. The on/off switch is difficult to use (it's sort of recessed) and you can only date your pic AFTER you've taken it! There is NO user manual. You have to read it on line and if you want something to have in your hand, you need to print it yourself, ALL 67 Pages! I'm sure that I've forgotten something about this awful camera but you get the idea. These are just some of the low lights! Save yourself a lot of grief and BUY SOMETHING ELSE. I am returning the camera this morning as soon as the stores open!

Reviews.Title: Not worth it for Mac users
Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this works for PCs but the software for Macs is awful. Also it's almost impossible to use the Easy Share button and not worth the effort! I would go back to a Canon if I could afford it. The camera itself is easy to use, but even to get your picture onto the computer or use them with your own photo software (iPhoto for example) it ridiculously difficult and time consuming.

Reviews.Title: How to...
Reviews.Author: TinkPA
Reviews.Content: OK, I give up...  how do I simply save photos to my pc?  Despite installing the software, my laptop does not recognize the actual camera and the s/w only sends images to the internet (FB, kodak, email, etc).  And it requires my email password to send images off the camera, which isn't good.  All I want to do is download the images to a folder on my laptop, like I have done with every other digital camera I have owned.  What am I missing here???And as noted by other reviewers, this camera has no ac port, so only works on batteries.Update:  I quickly discovered that I could easily remove the SD card and read it on my computer.  It opens like a directory and I can copy files and clean up the card before returning it to the camera.  Also, this camera takes videos, too.  I am a happy user!

Reviews.Title: Not Crazy for........
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: I'm not happy that it doesn't have the date & time stamp on each photo.  I have to manually put it on each one.  And you have to do it on the day the picture is taken.  I "up graded" to this camera... and that is really one big disappointment.!  I do like the picture quality.  The buttons are really small also.  And it is a light camera.

Reviews.Title: Crappy pictures!
Reviews.Author: Michele Garrant
Reviews.Content: I was excited to see this camera at such a low price especially with all the share options. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT buy this camera. I originally bought this for my mom for Mother's Day. I got the camera, opened it and tried it out just to be disappointed. This camera take horrible blurry/grainy photos and you have to hold it very still for it to even come out semi clear. It's just a huge waste of money and time seeing I now have to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Great features thou
Reviews.Author: KathyEverts
Reviews.Content: I really lie the features of this camera. It is very user friendly, it is just that some of my camera features are not working this past days. Maybe I need to have it checked. But all in all I really love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Used as  Gift
Reviews.Author: Joe B. Walker "YesIamapirate"
Reviews.Content: Used for Xmas gift to Teen charity gift exchane. Did not know then end recipient and cannot rate product or performance

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Picchione
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures with no skill required.All I have to do is point and shoot and  I get beautiful shots and if I mess up I can easily delete it.This is the perfect camera for a 71 yr. old grandmother like me or for anyone who wants to get great photos with no effort at all.

Reviews.Title: better for kids
Reviews.Author: Andria "andria102"
Reviews.Content: Cute camera, does the job. Not the most clear, and takes batteries. The screen is large, and it is light weight

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: The images are clear, the camera is simple and easy to use, transferring the pictures to the computer took zero time. Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Don't up load to youtube,flick,
Reviews.Author: L. Richards "L8r"
Reviews.Content: Go product, but it doesn't upload to youtube anymore nor flick. False advertisement.  Please reajust this. Want refund I can't do the what the product says I can.

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: Robert Go Van
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare C195 digital camera eats batteries like a child eats candy.There is No support site online.This really sucks.

Reviews.Title: don't buy!
Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work!! The software is broken and won't install. There fore I cannot get any of my pictures onto my computer! This is junk!!!

Reviews.Title: GOOD DEAL FOR A BASIC DIGITAL CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: cp7622
Reviews.Content: These are easy to use, and bargain priced, not to mention good quality photos.Too bad Kodak is no longer making cameras.

Reviews.Title: Purple is a pretty color.
Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: NOT easy share. But it  could be because I am techno-stupid. But really- I would think that a company like Kodak would assume this and make the instructions VERY simple. They might have thought they did.....but not enough for me. I never could figure out how to "share" like they said.

Reviews.Title: You would be better to spend your money on a meal.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Had the mailers just tested this camera before they sent it to me, I would not have had to send it back. It is like Russian roulette to get a good C195. I went and got a used C875 from a reputable seller and it works for me. There are so many good things that this camera could have done...except it had a hair trapped inside the lense and it made for a rainbow across every image. Also the case felt like a pepsi can. It was too light and had a fragile feeling. Plus the zoom created a blurred image so that was a killer for this cam. I got all my money back. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Anthony Mills
Reviews.Content: I have had a kodak easyshare camera before and loved it. That is why I ordered this one. So far it is taking beautiful photos and I had prompt delivery so I am more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Not What Was Expected
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: From the moment this camera arrived, I disliked it. I did not find it "easy to use" at all. Everything I attempted to do did not work. Several people looked at it with me and they could not get it to work properly either. I phoned and contacted Best Buy and was unable to reach anyone to tell me where to send the camera back since my son had thrown the box away with the invoice/return label in it. The result is that I have a camera I cannot and will not be using in my closet. Do not recommend if you are the type of person, like me, who just wants to snap a picture quickly and go.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: L. Phillips
Reviews.Content: Bought this, used it for about a year and upgraded. The picture quality was not so great, the options weren't accurate (for instance, the setting for party, when I took pics at a party, they were all blurry) and the reset time after each shot was long.

Reviews.Title: Awful little camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I compared this to the Olympus camera that was a similar price. Due to this camera's slightly lower price and good reviews, I bought it. It is going into the trash as soon as I get my new Olympus. This camera has trouble focusing. Most photos I take are blurry, even after allowing it time to bring the focusing box on screen. You can't just shoot a picture, you have to coax it out of the camera. Taking many photos with the flash is a slow process. The camera misfires frequently so you end up with lots of black photos. When the flash does work, it only barely lights a room. On 90% of my interior shots I have to lighten the photos in a computer software program. There is no way I have found to adjust the Fstop as there is in the Olympus so you are at the mercy of it's auto adjust to everything and it's not too picky about getting things lit or focused. The viewfinder has an adjustment so you can lighten what you see there, but then you aren't getting what you see on the viewfinder! The viewfinder may show a light photo but after you download it you realize it's very dark. What good is that?I use this to photo houses I work on and it's a pain. I'll never buy another cheap Kodak camera again!

Reviews.Title: Battery Vampire
Reviews.Author: nursemc
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for a year now. I have had Kodak Easyshares before that I was very pleased with. This camera however is a battery vampire. I've tried every battery including those specifically designed to be low drain (after much research I recommend Sanyo Enloop). I have to take the batteries out every time I use the camera or they will be dead the next time I turn it on. As long as you're using the camera and snapping pics all day long, the battery life is great, just don't let the camera sit for more than two days. The pics are good quality although regardless of whether I have the redeye reduction on or not and whether the subject looks at the camera or not, the pics all have redeye which is weird. All in all it's a decent camera for the price but although I have been loyal to Kodak my whole life, this camera has me considering looking at other brands for my next purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kodak digital camera c195
Reviews.Author: amara
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare c195 has more pixels and a little bit nicer looks than my old c663. I accidentally dropped c663 a few times, but nothing breaked off the camera, and the electronic components were last for 6 years. I was happy for that. For c195, I thought it must be better because it is newer version. Unfortunately, it was last for 3 months. The door that cover battery was loosen, popping out while shooting. I was going to return but no luck. The last time I was taking a picture then the battery door opened again, and that cause the camera slipped off my hand dropped to the ground. Two pieces of the camera frames, the top covered and the tiny function bottons came off. They looked alike pieces of  cheap toys that connecting to each others by the tiny latches on the edges. I managed them back in place. The three little buttons, flash, mode, and power are working but the shutter button is not working. Now, I can not return it because I do not have an insurance and no idea how to get it repair. It is better if they make the frame of c195 like c663. My first kodak camera was black and white, 50 year ago. It is the time to say good-bye to kodak camera. I just want to tell you who want to buy the Kodak EasyShare C195, must think over and over before you get less than you pay.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've ever used, useless on mac
Reviews.Author: cometlinear "artistic programmer"
Reviews.Content: Camera won't mount on my macs as a hard drive, and the easyshare software can't find it.The buttons on the device itself are terrible.This is a cut rate product, and it functions like one.

Reviews.Title: power button difficult to use
Reviews.Author: Angela Meder "ticket lady"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures. The only problem I have is turning it on and off.  The buttons on top are tiny and recessed and difficult to use.  Once it's turned on it's great.  I would not recommend it because of that problem.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: StephMA
Reviews.Content: I have always had a Kodak EasyShare camera and for the price you really get alot.  The clarity of the pictures is incredible and people always ask me what type of camera I have and are shocked that it is not a a very expensive camera.  Downloading videos and uploading them to Facebook or You Tube is a since and I'm very technology challenged, so if I have no problem with this then anyone can operate this camera.  Love the share button feature and the fact that you can share photos with several social networking sites when you put the information in.  There is nothing about this camera that I can say is bad...get this camera and enjoy it I sure am!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: We liked the camera in many ways but found it too difficult to use with the very small buttons.  This camera could be great if this feature improves.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: ctips
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 3 weeks now.  I have taken alot of pictures with it.  So far, the quality is good for the price.  I work for a professional photographer on the side and I was looking for something small and light that I could put in my purse, besides a 3mp cell phone.  The clarity is very good for the small package.  It will do rapid shoot, which was great for my daughters dance recital and will be great for when she opens her gifts on Christmas morning.  This is the first Kodak I have ever purchased. I'm pretty happy with it.  Other reviewers have said that it eats batteries like crazy.  Well, after you've been shooting with professional DSLR cameras and see how much battery they eat, it really didn't seem that bad to me.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the C360.
Reviews.Author: Lou Von Esh
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with a few major components.First, I found the on/off switch is difficult to activate. It is necessary to use a finger nail. What about those poor people who chew their nails...good luck.Second, I was surprised to see that the 5X zoom seemed less especially since the C360 I have used for years could digitized what seems to be twice the distance.Third, I would have asked for my money back, but the penalty was too severe.

Reviews.Title: Worst piece of consumer electronics I have purchased
Reviews.Author: Kennen Haas "Kennen"
Reviews.Content: The camera had terrible latency issues.I would throw it in the garbage if I was unable to return it.I turn it on. The screen comes on. I set the date and time.I try to activate the zoom. I seems not to work, about 3-4 seconds later the zooming occurs.I press the button to take a picture... nothing. I press again and, click, picture taken. I try to uses the thumb pad to delete the picture, no response. The screen goes black. At this point the camera is totally non-responsive.I press the power button to turn it off, but the lens stays open for about 10 seconds before it goes off.This is the second Kodak camera I have purchased that has been dysfunctional to the point of being useless.Fool me once... you know the rest.

Reviews.Title: I Should Have Stuck With Canon...
Reviews.Author: G. H. Giroux "Eccentric Writer & World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I guess you do get what you pay for, but the $79 for this camera was overpriced. So many things wrong with it:1.  I ordered the blue, which was lovely in the product picture. When I opened the box, I swore: they sent me a black one instead. Wrong. Upon microscrutinizing it, it was dark, dark, DARK blue. Barely 'blue.'2.  The function 'buttons' are made for Lilliputians with tiny fingers. Very hard to depress with a normal-sized finger.3.  The package does not include an instructional guide, just a tiny foldout thing with very scant info in 4 different languages.4.  To view the guide you have to log on to an internet site. Shameful that a decent quick-guide couldn't be included to carry around.5. This camera is supposed to be able to be set for sepia and black & white photos. On the online guide it tells you which buttons to click, and the color setting is one function under a menu category called 'Capture.' The guide has around 7 or 8 selections under Capture: the camera has three, and color is not one of them.6.  The transference from the camera to the PC is not as one-step as the Canon, and you have to click on several options to get to where you can upload.Kodak: uh uh - never again.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Already reported situation when camera was returned.  upon first use, camera lens stuck in extended position and would not withdraw when camera was shut down.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I've had the displeasure of using
Reviews.Author: S. Watkins "Anubis"
Reviews.Content: I have a part time job as a lister to earn some extra cash which requires me to take numerous photographs with a digital camera. One of the camera's is the Easyshare C195. I have an old 1megapixel A10 Canon that not only takes better pictures than the C195, it's far less frustrating.  My biggest complaint with the C195 is the fact that the camera never seems to focus on the object you are shooting, but the wall or a random space. The pictures at times look clear on the screen, but once downloaded are very blurry. I have never seen a camera take so many out of focus pictures. I had to take a picture of a Coach bag from every angle. I took 47 pictures of the front of the bag in our staging area. Not a single one of them was in focus. The camera also likes to apply some yellow filter at times to ruin pictures. I've also noticed that if battery life is less than 50%, the camera will not download pictures to the pc but rather an error will display.

Reviews.Title: Processing... "zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz"
Reviews.Author: tickyette
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. There are just a few things about it that bother me. Every time I want to review my picture the words "Processing photos" comes up and I have to wait for a few minutes before I can flip through my photos. The zooming is a little delayed as well. I have to push the button twice before it does anything. Also, and this is the big problem for me, even with the flash the pictures will sometimes turn out blurry. A nice looking camera, but I wouldn't recommend it. :/

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I've had the displeasure of using
Reviews.Author: S. Watkins "Anubis"
Reviews.Content: I have a part time job as a lister to earn some extra cash which requires me to take numerous photographs with a digital camera. One of the camera's is the Easyshare C195. I have an old 1megapixel A10 Canon that not only takes better pictures than the C195, it's far less frustrating.  My biggest complaint with the C195 is the fact that the camera never seems to focus on the object you are shooting, but the wall or a random space. The pictures at times look clear on the screen, but once downloaded are very blurry. I have never seen a camera take so many out of focus pictures. I had to take a picture of a Coach bag from every angle. I took 47 pictures of the front of the bag in our staging area. Not a single one of them was in focus. The camera also likes to apply some yellow filter at times to ruin pictures. I've also noticed that if battery life is less than 50%, the camera will not download pictures to the pc but rather an error will display.

Reviews.Title: Processing... "zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz"
Reviews.Author: tickyette
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. There are just a few things about it that bother me. Every time I want to review my picture the words "Processing photos" comes up and I have to wait for a few minutes before I can flip through my photos. The zooming is a little delayed as well. I have to push the button twice before it does anything. Also, and this is the big problem for me, even with the flash the pictures will sometimes turn out blurry. A nice looking camera, but I wouldn't recommend it. :/

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Giniamay
Reviews.Content: I've had my share of digital cameras.  I was real impressed with this one.  Never had a purple one before which was nice.  The pictures look amazing.  You'll be very happy with this one for sure.Ginia

Reviews.Title: Good camara.
Reviews.Author: T. Nathe
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for my 9yr old son.  He loves it and 6mo's later it's still working fine.  I don't know how to use it but he had no problem figuring it out.  Price was reasonable also.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C195
Reviews.Author: gloranne
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift. She really loves it and has taken many pictures. She loves the large screen, and ease of use. I only gave it 4 stars because it does not come with a memory card or a rechargeable battery pack. It does come with two batteries.

Reviews.Title: Worst piece of consumer electronics I have purchased
Reviews.Author: Kennen Haas "Kennen"
Reviews.Content: The camera had terrible latency issues.I would throw it in the garbage if I was unable to return it.I turn it on. The screen comes on. I set the date and time.I try to activate the zoom. I seems not to work, about 3-4 seconds later the zooming occurs.I press the button to take a picture... nothing. I press again and, click, picture taken. I try to uses the thumb pad to delete the picture, no response. The screen goes black. At this point the camera is totally non-responsive.I press the power button to turn it off, but the lens stays open for about 10 seconds before it goes off.This is the second Kodak camera I have purchased that has been dysfunctional to the point of being useless.Fool me once... you know the rest.

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: sheila r conley
Reviews.Content: Thought I was ordering another brand, too much trouble to return it.  I have not used it.  I like cannon

Reviews.Title: I never received it!
Reviews.Author: Tasha Taylor
Reviews.Content: It probably would have been a nice camera, but I'll never know! Instead of a camera, I received a board game. It's been over a month since I ordered the camera, and I still haven't received a refund. If you order one-good luck on getting it.

Reviews.Title: A Dud
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 9 year old son. We got it and installed the batteries included and it didn't work. We used fresh batteries and it didn't work. We're returning it.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!! Batteries are NOT rechargeable!!!
Reviews.Author: AngelMommy
Reviews.Content: this Camera use two AA batteries. this is the only of my cameras that doesnt have rechargeable batteries. and the battery life is SUPER short. need to change the batteries after 1 day. a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Kirsten
Reviews.Content: One star is all this one is definitly worth!  I only had this camera a month and then it turn to a piece of crap!

Reviews.Title: Not particularly good for most photography
Reviews.Author: Jerrie Brock "Jerrie Brock"
Reviews.Content: This would not be a bad camera if you just want to take pictures of the family around the house.  For anything much beyond that, its not very good. It may actually be one of Kodak's worse. The buttons are tiny, in a crevice and not easy to use unless you can look at the camera in the light. You will never be able to turn the camera on quickly for a spontaneous photo. Not really all that big of a deal since it won't capture a quick picture anyway. The delay from the time you press the button to take the picture and the camera records it is so long that many subjects will not even be in the picture. Tried to take pics of the Air Force Thunderbirds, the only way possible is to 'snap' the picture before the planes are even within the camera's viewfinder.  Then many times, it will blur a picture anyway. Turning the flash on and off, too difficult. Cannot turn flash on by the push of a button (it will only go to auto) you have to go to the programs. The program menu takes a while to navigate so you may lose a picture while trying to find a workable setting. And if the camera goes into auto shut off, you have to go through the whole programing thing again because it will come back on in auto only. All in all, the worse I have ever had and I have always been a huge Kodak fan. Don't have any idea what they were thinking of but this is a huge disappointment. Again, for a planned family event or some thing similar, probably good enough. For capturing special unplanned moments, you will just be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: returning
Reviews.Author: koby
Reviews.Content: I like it because it can get new aa battries whenever but does not take good night pictures, which i use mine for and the three buttons on top are hard to push because they are so small and close together

I set the date and time.I try to activate the zoom. I seems not to work, about 3-4 seconds later the zooming occurs.I press the button to take a picture... nothing. I press again and, click, picture taken. I try to uses the thumb pad to delete the picture, no response. The screen goes black. At this point the camera is totally non-responsive.I press the power button to turn it off, but the lens stays open for about 10 seconds before it goes off.This is the second Kodak camera I have purchased that has been dysfunctional to the point of being useless.Fool me once... you know the rest.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE.....
Reviews.Author: Dana Y. Bowles "DYB"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two EasyShare cameras for my daughters last Christmas....they looked to be affordable, decent first cameras.  I had no idea that I was simply throwing money away.  Battery life is so poor it's like Kodak has played a joke on the consumer.....and the batteries are NOT rechargeable.  Not at all sure what the purpose of the cable is...it doesn't charge the camera, and it's not necessary to transfer the pictures.  My daughter received this latest model as a gift....and it is just as much of a piece of junk as the earlier model.  The construction is so poor (even the buttons) that I have to keep reminding myself that it's not a toy.  Completely shocked that Kodak would produce such a piece of junk and even more disappointed that they are allowed to sell it---or rather, steal money from consumers.DYB

Reviews.Title: THIS CAMERA SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Geren L Williams
Reviews.Content: On-line with Kodak now .... the agent is telling me that this camera does not come with the easyshare software but with the sharebutton app. The camera will only transfer photos to my computer using this. THE ISSUE IS THAT MY COMPUTER DOES NOT RECOGNIZE THE FRIGGIN' CAMERA!I bought this today and am taking it back TOMORROW!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Tough Reviewer "chemg"

It takes forever for picture to get stored to memory card once you snap your picture. My memory card has speed of 4, which is standard memory card speed and my other cameras store it in 1 second. Next thing that sucks is that you have to hold you hand still when you take pictures or they will come out blurry. If you use flashlight your pictures will most of the time come out blurry. Video quality sucks really bad, it's all grainy like ancient old tv picture quality with snow in it. The sound in the video is really bad as well. Can't even compare with my 10 year old digital camera by sony. I tried to connect it to computer to upload pictures but it would never turn on. It was always like this since I purchased it. I had to put in memory card in my other camera to be able to upload pictures on pc. If you want headache and problems in your life.. this is the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: Alkaline battery is 100% used after taking about 10 pictures or so
Reviews.Author: Radha Sundaresan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera thinking the price was low, kodak was a great household brand and the AA alkaline battery option would obviate the need for home battery recharging. Also it is easy to carry an extra pair of AA batteries. To my shock and dismay, the batteries died after taking about 10 photos the first time I used it and that too while in the midst of an important home function photo-taking session. Thought the battery was bad and replaced with a new set of batteries and same thing happened again. Used to have a cannon camera with a rechargable lithuim battery before this camera that served me well for many years. Now I am trying out rechargeable AA battery for the Kodak camera. Hopefully I will have more luck.

Reviews.Title: Kodak  easay share C195 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Penny P. Levert
Reviews.Content: Would NOT recommend product...it came without a memory card.  Has internal storage for 10 pictures.  What good is a camera that takes only ten pictures?  I will be contacting Kodak about this problem and if I am not satisfied I shall return it ASAP.
